He showed great hospitality towards me and my family and making sure that I have a very comfortable stay at Grand Park Orchard.  Indeed, I had a wonderful time staying with you guys. The room and shower area were big. My son totally enjoyed playing in the bathtub (me too actually). Only sad part was that we didn’t get to enjoy the swimming pool the next day as my son was feeling under the weather, maybe from too much playing in the bathtub!  Overall, we enjoyed ourselves there. Thank you once again Mr Zul and the rest of the team at Grand Park Orchard!  …

14.review_text: One of the best customer service experience i had at this hotel. From the front desk to the dining area and even housekeeping.  Centralise location in town. And easy access to most mall. And definitely food places that is close to the location

15.review_text: Covenient area to shop all around orchard. Spoilt with food choices!  But the room have not been fully ready as there is no curtain in the bathroom and also bathrobe. Overall if was just okay staying here!

16.review_text: Thought this 5 star rated hotel will be a good stay but the room that I stayed in, the fridge was very dirty, the shower handle easily drop off, the anti slip mat for the bath tub had mold and was dirty.   I felt the maintenance wasn't up to standard and furniture and equipment should be changed/upgraded.

17.review_text: overall, it was great to be there...........nice location, everything within your reach, a very accommodating staff at reception, we didnt have the chance to try the food, but its look great, maybe next time, sure we are coming back again.......

18.review_text: Hair dryer wasnt working, called concierge, no one picked up. No mask or hand sanitizer given, even lower stars hotel gave that. Bath room had scary glass door that looks like it might break. Air-con temperature does not work. But bathtub is hug and water is hot straight away, which is good.

19.review_text: Fazli has excellent customer service! He serve us well in the dining place. He is very attentive and friendly. I'm very satisfied with his hospitality! We felt very welcome! Highly recommended staff!!

20.review_text: Currently checked into the hotel. Arrived early but there was about a 30 minute queue, which is reasonable. Paid for a Club Deluxe Room.  Now what's inexcusable is the absolutely filthy state of the room. Literally thick layers of dust and grime - not just in corners and under tables but on the TV console, the chair, and other high use areas. Couldn't even reach concierge to ask for cleaning - there literally wasn't any reply after 20min ringing.  It's frankly horrendous. Avoid it at all cost.

21.review_text: Was misled by the website. Paid for crystal club room but upon check in was I told that the crystal club lounge was closed and I had to join the check in at the lobby with the other guests. Took 2.5 hr to check in. Came at 3 sharp check in at 530. Didn’t get to even use the crystal club lounge but paid for it anyway. Very disappointing. Can’t even do a website right. Should’ve been more specific on the descriptors if the lounge was closed. Why was it omitted?  Otherwise, the room was good and so was the service.

22.review_text: Polite and friendly customer service at front desk.  Safe entry procedures were in place.  Cleanliness of the hotel was up to our standard as the rooms were well maintained.  Recommended to go for staycation

23.review_text: Checked in for 1 night staycation on a busy weekend. Located in the middle of orchard road. Check in was smooth, need to wait abit due to holiday season. Room was nice and cosy. Service staff is nice. The only issue i had was that it was abit noisy due to the location. Otherwise nice stay overall.

24.review_text: Please do not book this hotel if you are celebrating special occasion. very disappointing since check-in, room is not clean, bathrobes being crumpled and dumped one side in the wardrobe. Floor is not vacuumed, soap glass panel is not clean. service recovery by staff is bad

25.review_text: Nice hotel. Check in is also in orderly manner. Service staff and manager is very good and helpful. Will recommend.  Pool is bit small. Toilet is clean. Very good location. Good for people who like shopping.

26.review_text: They call themselves a 5 star hotel, but hotel 81 geylang has better standards. Give staff Fred back but they will brush u aside. No toilet pape, no tissue box. Rooms were small and extremely filty. This hotel is not even 1/2 a star. Attitude problem staff. Don't stay here.

27.review_text: A good place to stay with excellent service staff that will make you feel just like home. There even send me a full size birthday cake for my birthday it was so nice of them to do that for me. For sure will come back again

28.review_text: Hotel located at super strategy location,  central of Orchard which make me easy to travel  from here & there and looking for good food. Excellent service staff, hotel clean and comfortable, with not really have noise interrupt.

29.review_text: This is my second visit at Grand Park Orchard. The stay experience is great and we are returning in April ;P  Particularly I like their club lounge service so much, free flow red wine, beer and hard liquor. And the bartenders are very friendly, we enjoy ourselves a lot at Mitzo.

30.review_text: This is will be the first time and last time I stay with Grand Park Orchard.. Q for 2 hours for check in and no social distancing at all.. rooms still cleaning when 5pm, and the two housekeeping trolley was park between my room.. and shampoo bottle was drop on the floor in front of my room.. how am I going to get into the room.. the smell at the corridor was terrible..   Totally unacceptable for a hotel in Orchard Rd and with this kind of prices! Went for complimentary breakfast, international buffet became set breakfast which you are only able to take 1 set, understandable during current pandemic, but should mention on website or during check in..  I will not stay at grand park Orchard anymore and not recommend all my friend and family l..

31.review_text: Awesome staycay. Front desk staff was accommodating to my request, they are amazing and friendly as well. It was a hassle free check in and out, perfect me-time staycay!  Rooms are spacious, toilet is amazing. Just love everything about this hotel.

32.review_text: good services even during COVID-19. very peaceful place to stay or honeymoon  ! ! the staffs all good and polite ! and the food and room service ! no at night time but they still entertain you with good services !

33.review_text: Really smooth check in with a very helpful and accommodating receptionist; room was perfect for a single traveller and had everything that was necessary. The 24/7 gym was also great and I had the whole gym to myself since I went at 1am! Clean, convenient location to all the shopping hubs in the area, lots of food options.

34.review_text: Check in was delayed but was given a free upgrade so that was very nice of the staff. Check out was fuss free. Menu of in room dining should be updated as I was charged more than what was indicated on the menu. Food was disappointing for a “5 star hotel.”

35.review_text: Choosing the Club Premier room In Grand park orchard hotel was one of the best decisions made! Perfect stay for both me and my wife! Will definitely come back again, but will book the suite room the next time!

36.review_text: It was really a fantastic service from start to finish, rooms was amazing too! Thank you to everyone at Grand Park Orchard for making our stay such a fantastic one. Thank you to Kim from Guest Service Office for making my stay an amazing one too! :)

37.review_text: We decided a weekend get away near orchard road and booked a night at grand park orchard . We were greeted by a very attentive front office officer by the name of Lovely . She is by far one of the best frontline staff who did a fast check in and pre empt all my expectations. She put us in room 1040 and took us through in details on the details . We checked in on 07 Mar 2021 , she is a gem ! Room was clean and good . Location is fantastically convenient! Great hotel n staff ! Thanks lovely !

38.review_text: For a supposedly upscale hotel, there was a thick layer of dust (could write on it) on surfaces such as the TV console, kettle, and mini fridge that suggested that it had not been cleaned for several months, which was appalling given that these “high touch” surfaces should be sanitized frequently after every stay.   Service was poor as well because I repeatedly called room service, concierge and operator, basically every available number, at 10pm to ask for a bucket of ice but nobody answered the calls. I gave up calling at 10.40pm and went to the front desk myself, only to be told that room service ceased at 10.30pm. Where were you from 10pm to 10.30pm?

39.review_text: An excellent service provided by Mr. Zul of Grand Park Orchard.  He was patient in explaining my enquires and was kind to make arrangements that were convenient for my family and I. I truly appreciate and applaud to such excellent service provided. Thank you and we enjoyed our stay!

40.review_text: great service rendered by hotel staffs and the check in process was fuss free. location wise: so close to everything in town! great for muslims as it is situated next to Masjid Al-falah. i had a memorable stay with my best friend and this will definitely not be my last stay. Also, the pillows & bed was sooo comfortable, we knocked out once it was time for bed! Thank you so much for the wonderful stay.

41.review_text: No issues whatsoever. Great if you have had to work from home too during your hotel stay, because the internet connection was very stable. Housekeeping was also very attentive to my needs, as it was a solo stay.

42.review_text: Genuinely a good stay right smack in the heart of Singapore's shopping belt. Located directly opposite Paragon Shopping Centre, Grand Park Orchard provides an affordable stay. Suitable for ones who doesn't expect much facilities from the hotel.  Professional check in, kudos to Front Desk Kim for her patience and enthusiasm to help. Remembering guest by their last name throughout my stay.   Shall not critic too much on the negativity as feedback to the GM on the work required to be done. Hopefully, my feedback serves its purpose. Should I ever return to stay someday, I do hope to see the light shed on this hotel.

43.review_text: My wife and I enjoyed our statycation very much. For 170 dollars per night, at the heart of orchard room, the rate is a steal.  Room is clean and modern, albeit small. Services are good and prompt. Excellent.

44.review_text: Very nice place. Ryan in the front office was very helpful in addition to being friendly yet professional. The hotel is located in the heart of Orchard Road thus allowing for easy access to most places in the area.

45.review_text: The hotel furniture is a little aged. What we enjoyed about this hotel is that the staff had very excellent service. Always a greeting and a smile from front desk to chambermaids. Even the morning duty manager in the restaurant gave us such warmth during our breakfast. Stayed on Valentine’s Day. Place was not too crowded which was good also. Gym and pool was empty also so that was good for us as we had the whole place to ourselves.

46.review_text: everthing is good, only not halal certified, so never try any food or drink. the location is good, the swimming pool is a bit small ,but still not bad, the staff is all friendly , i like the bed, it is good. keep up the good work .

47.review_text: Great place to be at and what makes it great is the hotel team like Kim, Azli, Lovely, Ryan and the rest of the team was super friendly and accommodating.  I will recommend to all to be here when visiting Singapore so u can do all the shopping.  Goes to all locals also.  Keep it up Grand Park Orchard team for the good work.

48.review_text: With 10 over empty parking space n the car park attendance claimed it was full.. refused hotel guests to park even if the package is with car park facility.. I dun even dare to drive my car out for 2 nights staying there after much clarification with them that there were empty lots ..

49.review_text: Will never stay again.Rooms are dated check in process was long.Only redeeming factor was the location.Facilites are basic only. No club access. Frozen food served as high tea and cocktail snacks. Whatever was written on the booking about 30 percent or more not fulfilled. If you ask for more staff will talk behind your back. TV was not working and technician was rude when they could not fix the issue.

50.review_text: Impressive room! Booked the club room and didn’t expect it to be so nice. Late check out provided also! Only thing parking have to pay $20 per day. Only one time exit Thank you for your help RYAN( AM)

51.review_text: Staffs are very professional, friendly and helpful.  Rooms are clean and bed was very comfortable for sleep.  Highly recommended for the hotel restaurant - Mitzo. Foods are so nice and staffs are very friendly.  Really enjoyed to stay here.

52.review_text: I would like to take this opportunity to give praise to hotel staff Ryan. While I was rudely disturbed that there was no parking left for hotel guests,Ryan explained the situation patiently and offered alternative solutions that were very reasonable. As hotel guests we do appreciate the stellar and prompt  service provided by Ryan, all doing it with a million dollar smile behind the mask which beamed though his eyes. The check in process was also hassle free and seamless despite slightly longer waiting times but again, the service provided by Ryan made it less painful.

53.review_text: Location was perfect. Staffs were friendly. Easy check in and check out. It was a pleasant stay. Was celebrating my birthday at the time of stay. Rooms were clean and organised. Even my kids were enjoying it.

54.review_text: Im happy with my stay with my kids. Room is big and clean come with bathtub, the kids enjoy. Thank you. Location is good too just facing Paragon, easily can shop or dine. Will definitely come back again. :)

55.review_text: Room found to be dirty with dust all around hidden places such as underneath tables, fridge, bed frame where the spotlights are with faulty fridge, multiple wall sockets, dirty bathtub, loose hooks (for hanging towels, mounted mirror) poor iron. The television too that it does not make any sense of the eye level as the bed appears to be higher than the tv, it should be wall mounted with an eye level elevated plus to our disappointment that the Concierge counter does not have any auto operator mentioning that it is not in operation until we called the main hotline. It’s so unprofessional. I could envisage that I would no longer have any interest in making any booking moving forward and this shall not be a recommendation list.

56.review_text: Overall a good and enjoying stay. No queue during the check-in, smooth check-in. King size bed with good and comfortable blanket.  Location is in the center of orchard road, opposite is paragon / takashimaya. Easy to access by mrt or bus.  Check-out there is a express drop box, so no worry if you are in a rush to check-out.   Overall good stay.

57.review_text: It was ALMOST a perfect stay. Sadly there were issues with the piping system that night and it kept us up the whole time😭 We refused a room change as moving seemed like a hassle.  Duty manager Azri was so kind to offer late checkout the next day but we couldn't as we had appointments planned. We would definitely want to re-do the whole staycation and make it a PERFECT stay if possible!😃

58.review_text: The hotel room we stayed was clean and space was good. But customer service can be better as our room's TV was faulty and when I tried calling the front desk or concierge, nobody picks up the phone. I personally went down to the front desk to inform them about our issue with the TV, but nobody came to check. In any case, they are probably understaffed at the present moment. Overall a pleasant place for a stay.

59.review_text: Great hotel and totally underrated! In the heart of Orchard and so close to so many amenities. Love the level 4 and love the Canopy Bar atmosphere. Kim served us sincerely at front desk so thank you for that! Paid a little extra for access to Executive Lounge and unfortunately it was closed. Felt like this could have been communicated before the stay to avoid the disappointment. Room was clean and spacious and bed was comfortable - had a great sleep! However, a bit unfortunate that their bathroom fittings are of low quality. Even the lounge chairs at level 4 are not well-maintained (stained etc). Other than that, all’s lovely and dandy! Might just come back to sit about at the Canopy!

60.review_text: The place was nice and cozy. The bed was soft and the food i ordered via room service was absolutely delish! Highly recommended! The toilet is very clean, just that there wasnt any hose so a minus for that. but apart from that, i would love to book at this hotel in the future.

61.review_text: Overall experience is very good. Will definitely stay in this hotel again. Staff are friendly. The room is very clean. I love the bath tub. Wifi connection is stable. The bed is so confy. Was able to sleep well.

62.review_text: Good breakfast, wonderful service.  Thanks for the friendly service and accommodating to my requests.   Pity the bathtub in my room wasn't that clean as that was the highlight of my trip...  Location is great for shopping and many nearby malls with good food.

63.review_text: Very welcoming & friendly staffs! Had an early check in & late check out :) Upgraded to Premier for free coz birthday & they sent a small cake up to me! Thank you! Quite empty maybe coz school started and it's relatively quiet :)

64.review_text: I booked a room for one night on 16 Jan. One week before the check in i got an email from the reservation officer that if i wanted to do an early check-in, so why not right so i did the early check-in which is at 11am and i paid it thru visa. So when the day comes, i arrived before 11 and there were no queues at all. Check-in was smooth and breeze. My sil also book the same date but different booking as we use different name but she got a late check-out at 2pm, as for me 12noon. The hotel manager, Sufian who assists us with the bookings make our check-in very fast and smooth. Since we are family of 6 with 2 different room we were given a connecting room plus both room were given a late check-out at 2pm. And we were also given an Upgrade room! It was nice of him. Were given a…

65.review_text: Hotel facilities were great. Room (Crystal Club Premium) was large and kids had a very good time over all. Location at SG shopping belt made it to walk around and do some shopping. A bidet hose or a longer hose for the shower head for use with the toilet would have made it better. Food (breakfast) was exceptional. Nasi lemak is highly recommended.

66.review_text: Had an amazing stay in January with my partner. Special thanks to Shirah from FD,Joash from Mitzo and Tharma from IRD. Fantastic service, amazing hospitality and 10/10 attention to detail. Will be back!

67.review_text: customer service is good and superb experience. room is a bit small than expected but its clean and comfy bed. nice location, very near to shopping malls and mrt!  we will definitely go back and recommend the hotel , till next stay!

68.review_text: Came across over at Klook and it was a great deal whereby it comes with breakfast for your one night stay. On top of that with good service and accommodating staffs that can be easily approached. Both me and my partner are so happy with our stay and will definitely come back again in the future

69.review_text: service is wonderful by staffs. room is clean and spacious. good facilities and great bed comfort! check in and check out is quick and easy as there werent any queue. thank you grand park orchard for a wonderful stay :-))

70.review_text: Overall a good place to stay at , hotel is located near big shopping malls and walkable distance to paragon. In terms of hotel room , some minor issues to feedback on , fridge wasn't working and fridge cabinet door was damage causing the hinge door to fall off . In terms of customer service , staff were really friendly and helpful. Due to the current covid situation , choices for the breakfast menu was spoilt for but could only be limited to one per person which is understandable. Overall i had an enjoyable stay , hope to visit again!

71.review_text: Overall a good stay, but if I were to nitpick, some cleanliness in the towel, bathtub & air-quality can be improved. Hotel staffs were very good in their service, again if I were to find fault, a room-cleaner boy can greet better than the staffs at the temperature taking point and lobby.

72.review_text: As the government had earlier announced that there will be no fireworks in the City, we decided to book a night stay and cosily welcoming the New Year 2021 together as a family.   Made the right choice to book this hotel, was served by the Manager on Duty, Mr Azri. It was such a pleasant and fuss free check in. No long snake queues, everyone was being served as quickly as possible. Immediate check in, no need to wait. Albeit they can be seen being short staffed, but they indeed worked hand in hand smoothly. We also got a complimentary room upgrade.   I had requested a baby cot and Mr Azri I immediately get his housekeeper to send them to my room.   Room was clean, no cockroaches or insects, there’s a bath tub too, and tell you, the breakfast is to die for. Don’t miss it! Floor…

73.review_text: Follow up has been slow. Concerige no one answer. Kettle and Fridge not working. Room dusty. However, service still not too bad. Check in/out was pretty fast and without any hassel. TV cannot see youtube

74.review_text: We had a great one night stay at Grand Park Orchard. Check-in and check-out was fuss-free. Location was fantastic as it is in the heart of Orchard Road, within walking distance to most big malls (Taka, Paragon and Wisma Atria). Due to current covid restrictions, breakfast wait time was between 45-60min. Hotel was good to provide other options, 1) bento to dine-in room or 2) starbucks card with value. Overall, a great experience staying at Orchard Grand Park Orchard/

75.review_text: kettle spoilt, we have to tie to make it the water to cook. toilet so smelly. try to iron but still not straight.. cannot have breakfast in bed. cannot have late check out. swimming pool full.. not a good one for us and kids... kids really wanted to swim but no luck. what a waste.. hope for better service for the next stay. and reliable price.

76.review_text: It was a great staycation experience for my bf and myself, with very friendly staff around. The room was spacious and the bed was super comfortable! To top it off, thank you for the complimentary birthday cake! =)

77.review_text: took quite a while for car to be let into the carpark (about 40min) and check-in took almost an hour. club benefits are bad so no point booking the club rooms. service staff during the tea and ec were friendly and pleasant but food was quite pathetic. 2 small portions for each session per club room. for tea there were 2 miniature pieces of egg sandwich, macaron, curry puff, swiss rolls. all of them could fit in a small rectangular plate. evening cocktail was worse. rooms were pretty decent though. location of hotel is good, right in the middle of orchard. so i think if its a good option for tourists. but breakfast food was very average and service was really lacking. one older waiter was really rude, not just to our family but to other guests too. other staff were fine but could…

78.review_text: understand that they are having low manpower due to covid. Even though we did not expect to be served immediately, at least they could have just talked to us or communicate. Overall enjoyed the stay, the room was excellent with a view of Orchard Road.

79.review_text: It was an average hotel in town area. Certain stuff can be done better but couldn’t complain about it as it was booked at a discounted price. If they improve their breakfast service as well as standard i think it could been better

80.review_text: Stayed with family and was told to arrive at the hotel at 4pm. Room was not ready despite given the arrival time to them. But then again, it didn't take them long to assign us a room. We just waited at the lobby. The queue was managed well, comparing to the week where the posts of long queues were seen.  The twin bed in the room is just so tiny. So disappointing. TV channels were limited and is an old set where you can't mirror your screens to watch your own movies from your phones or Netflix. Other than those, the room is fine. No one picks up the calls when we wanted to ask if we can have some ice. Operator, Housekeeping, no one picked up.

81.review_text: To Grand Park Orchard  Thank you for the experience for me and my family.  You have a group of wonderful team players. From the reception, bartender, housekeeper and restaurant.  Thank you for the wonderful stay.

82.review_text: During our stay from Christmas's eve, the check-in procedure is efficient, hotel staff is polite and overall service is commendable, espeically now during this period Covid-19 pandemic!  We will plan to stay in your hotel for our next staycation.

83.review_text: I would like to register my sincere thank you to your staff Ryan Duty Manager for the stay on 27 DEC 2020  He has make our stay so lively even though is fully booked and busy period during the hotel stay. His hospitality professionalist service and dedication  has created a great impart to our stay.  We are fortunate to have him to be served by him to make our stay as extraordinary one.  I would like to commend the staff Ryan Duty Manager during my stay.  I found the Ryan Duty Manager to have the following characteristics.  1) Good attitude towards all guests in the hotel by listening to them and provide them to best comfort of stay.  2) His Creativity - Knowing the problem faced by guests and always find way to made it solved.  3) Knowledge - He have all the  knowledge of the…

84.review_text: Kudos to the the staffs of Grand Park Orchard for standing back up and managing the chaos that was faced initially! When I arrived on 22nd Dec at 3pm,there was no waiting time for check in. The process was smooth and the room was ready. The room was clean and spacious. Breakfast menu was adequate and there was also a halal bento set offered. This was a very nice gesture! There is complimentary parking for hotel guests and there were ample parking lots!Overall a very nice stay! Thank you Grand Park Orchard!

85.review_text: Poor housekeeping. The room came with 1 bath towel only. The temperature in the room cannot be controlled. Was set at 24 Deg Celsius and the room temp read 18 Deg Celcius. Overall, was quite disappointed in the stay.

86.review_text: I would like to commend Shirah for giving us a fantastic welcome and check-in. We were dreading the 5 hour queue but she helped us check-in within 15 mins. Unfortunately, the rooms took up to 2+ hours to be ready, despite already booking a check-in slot at 4pm. On the plus side, we booked club rooms so went to lounge for high tea and to wait.  I also admire Joash who worked at Mitzo lounge from morning breakfast till cocktail hour. He always has a smile on his face and provides good service.  Kudos to all the front line service and waiting staff.  Housekeeping on the other hand needs more resources. Some of the rooms were not supplied with hand towels. Only 2 bath towels and 1 toothbrush set were supplied. We had to remind them to supply us with bottled water. They were…

87.review_text: Good experience, excellent location! Thanks to the subsidy from the SGRediscover scheme, I chose this hotel for the proximity to our main shopping belt of Orchard Road. Even if the food and beverage outlets were limited within the hotel, there are plenty around in the vicinity, e.g just across the road is Prive, a premier dining outlet - part of Paragon, an excellent shopping mall.

88.review_text: Good location at the centre of shopping district. value for money for the location and hotel service and quality. There are many food hall, cafe and shopping in the surrounding. Especially good for photo taking during the Christmas season. Many Christmas lighting along the street.

89.review_text: They’re able to cater to our needs and upgrade our stay to club premier room. The afternoon tea and evening cocktail were   marvelous. Thanks for  making our staycation a memorable one.             Thanks. Will definitely come back as the location is convenient

90.review_text: I had a family staycation with my spouse and 2 teenagers. The check-in progress was smooth and very efficient. They managed to give us 2 rooms on the same floor but not really close to each other. The rooms were of a reasonable size. However, the housekeeping was not up to expectation. My room had only one bath towel and no laundry bag provided . My kids’ bathroom had no shower curtain and floor mat. However, the housekeeping staff was fast to respond and rectify when I called. As we had booked club benefit rooms, we were able to have afternoon tea at Mitzo and also evening cocktails. The ambience was nice and quiet. However , the variety of food could be wider. Also, only wines , champagne, whisky etc were provided but no cocktails. It would be nice if cocktails were provided…

91.review_text: I had the fortunate opportunity to stay at a Presidential Suite at Grand Park Orchard. Although there were some hiccups at check-in, the customer service provided by Mr Sufian was exceptional.   This luxurious one bedroom suite, located on the highest floor, offers a pretty good view of Orchard Road. It has a separate living room, dining area, kitchenette, master bedroom with en-suite marble bathroom and a separate guest toilet. But what really caught our eye is the study room. The study room is well-equipped and comfortable, perfect for some alone time.  Besides, Paragon is just a 3 mins walk away from the hotel, offering great convenience for our meal options.

92.review_text: Booked Grand Park Orchard Hotel for my parents on their Wedding Anniversary and they enjoyed it very much. Good location and is near to so many shopping areas. Will definitely choose this place again.

93.review_text: Went into the room, greeted by dusty countertops and phone. Was under the inpression that during this period, the surfaces should be cleaned regulary… woke up in the morning to unexpected visitors, ie, cockroaches which says alot about the cleaning standards… Totally unacceptable for a hotel in Orchard Rd and with this kind of prices! Went for complimentary breakfast, international buffet became set breakfast which you are only able to take 1 set, understandable during current pandemic, but would be better if they let people choose what they want instead of offering a set.

94.review_text: I had a fantabulous staycation at Grand Park Orchard Hotel. I would like to express my thanks and appreciation for the great services.My check-in was really a smooth one. Thank you to Ms Kim for assisting me on the check-in and placing us in a room with a beautiful view.She made our stay a wonderful and memorable one! The hotel is beautiful and a pleasant place for a family staycation. The breakfast at Mitzo restaurant was good too and we were being served by a very professional personnel, Mr Rashidi. Thumbs up for your professional and dedicated services!Overall thank you, Grand Park Orchard for the exceptional service excellence that made this staycation with my little family a priceless one!

95.review_text: I just want to say my checkin was a smooth one at Grand park orchard on 14 Dec. They even contacted us in the morning to inform us that late check in is at 7pm and thus late check out at 7pm.the housekeeping is also working very hard to ensure that the room is clean for us to check in. Kudos and thanks sandy for making the early morning phone call to inform us about the check in time, Sufian for making the calls to us that we can slowly check in at 6.30pm and also the housekeeping for making the room clean for our stay. You guys are a wonderful team for rectifying the problem that has occurred a few days ago and do a wonderful job in such a short time.

96.review_text: The hotel staff were friendly and the restaurant staff were accommodating to our dietary needs. We had a wonderful breakfast.   Check in was smooth, seamless and there was no crowd. Kudos to the hotel for ensuring that the processes to accommodate all guests check in were improved, after the unfortunate fiasco. I’m sure they worked hard to make sure that all guests had comfortable stays.   Room was clean and tidy. There were sufficient amenities.   I will definitely think of Grand Park Orchard for my next staycation.   Good job Grand Park Orchard staff! You have our support!

97.review_text: This hotel refuses to refund even when travellers cannot travel due to COVID. This is the most insincere and unwelcoming hospitality that can ever happen. Never would have thought to receive such horrible treatment from a first world country especially Singapore. Worst.

98.review_text: Queued for 6 hours waiting to check in. In the end was given options to either get a 100% refund or have a twin sharing room instead of the pre-booked King Deluxe. Service Manager was no way to be found.

99.review_text: Had a very pleasant stay at Grand Park Orchard. Was greeted by roger upon Arrival and the first impression was nice.The front office staff Kim,David, Jeff and Lovely was amazing. I had a very smooth check in and all my queries was answered with a smile. The room was spacious and very clean and during breakfast it was very smooth sailing line. Special shout-out to Ryan from F & B for the fast and amazing service.

100.review_text: Room took too long, room was dirty particularly the toilet, housekeeping was uncontactable, only saving saving grace was the guest relations officer - David, despite his poor health from being overworked, he still managed to greet me by name and with politeness bright and early in the morning.

1.review_text: We actually booked a staycation at park regis. However, due to the hotel being used for SHN instead, we were given a choice of going for the Nuve heritage or Park Royal pickering. We chose this hotel because of location. The room was fine. However, i would think an upgrading of the room is necessary. Room was a suite at level 6 and was the only room at that level.  The artist suite is the only room with an outdoor balcony. Which was nice. However, toilet tiles were stained yellow. Under the bed, there were a couple of used tissues when we entered. I would think during this covid era, proper housekeeping is highly important.   Electric kettle was dirty with obvious brown stains inside. And the dolce gusto machine, water compartment was yellow and pretty stained. It was rectified when we came back thanks to Joel quick response.  After our first night, housekeeping came and did the basic clean up. But a little confused on why a pile of towels were left behind instead of being cleared away.   Apart from all this little areas that needs improvement, the only thing that deserves a mention is Joel. He checked us in swiftly and was very patient in listening and attending to our needs. Always greeting us each time we walk by. He's a gem in your hotel and we hope you send this msg to him! Thank you Joel!  …

2.review_text: I was transferred here from Nuve at Clarke Quay and have received excellent service from both Nuve at Clarke Quay and Nuve Heritage. Every care was taken to ensure I had a comfortable stay, from check-in all the way through. Especially Ally the manager from Nuve Clarke Quay, to Joel and the manager, the reception and housekeeping team at Nuve Heritage, thank you all for making me feel at home.   The room is clean and spacious. Location is fantastic with lots of famous good food along Purvis street. Super convenient and central, highly recommend.

3.review_text: Upon checking in, I was impressed with the layout of the room( photographer suite). It has a unique layout of a loft style and is definitely spacious for 4pax.  It has 2 sinks, a bathtub and rain shower.  It also has another sink outside, along with a mini bar station with numerous wine glasses.   It provided us with complimentary snacks and drinks that are stored in the from the fridge. The bed is comfy and pillows are soft. The room looks pretty clean.  However, they have us 2 towels; 1 with an obvious strain on it and the other towel is town and looks like a rag cloth.   We called the room service to replace new towels and they did quickly and apologies for the unpleasant experience. Apart from that, the light switch is confusing. There were multiple switches but it seems only a few is working.   In addition to that, the bathtub experience wasn't a pleasant one. The bathroom tends to get flooded easily.   Overall, it's good for a one night stay.…

4.review_text: Generally had a pleasant experience except during check-out. The room was large and spacious. We enjoyed the bath tub a lot. The TOTO washlet was not working well. However, the staff were helpful and tried to solve it by changing the batteries. This did not solve the problem though. I think there is a sensor problem since it seems to work when we closed the toilet lid. That was a bit of a downer as we were excited to use it. The room was generally clean but there were quite a lot of ants whenever we had some coffee or snacks in the room. Room was generally quiet except for some car horn sounds along Prinsep. I would like to commend Joel for his attentiveness during our stay such as helping to keep our cake in the restaurant fridge and even answering all my queries promptly prior to the visit.   What really ruined my whole experience was at the check-out. I was asked to pay for a towel that had yellow stains by a female staff at the front desk. Since I had not seen that stain in my stay, I asked the staff about where it was and what it was stained by. The lady staff on-duty replied very condescendingly. I kept telling her I did not see that stain in any of the towels I used and she kept saying all the towels provided in the rooms were unstained so if it is stained it must be from our use.  I asked to look at where the towel was found and the staff brought me back to the room. I was told that the towel was found in a pile on the floor at the foot of the bed between the bed and night stand. My partner recalled using that towel the night before for a bath and it did not look stained. (None of the bath robes or other towels we used got stained so I do not think it was due to any of our bath products as well) It was still wet when he put it on the floor and I think it might have gotten stained from some dirt on the floor/ bottom of the bed or nightstand since it was still wet.   However, I was given no grace from this staff. In the end she did not charge me the extra charges but kept saying how she had the right to charge me and she was doing me this huge favor. I felt extremely disrespected by her attitude. Considering I also saw blood stains on the bedsheet but thought it was a minor issue and did not raise it up, I don't know why the staff are not able to provide some grace and magnanimity in this situation.…

5.review_text: Had a staycation at the hotel over the weekend and it was an excellent choice.  Centrally located to shopping and eateries, its a shorting walking distance to Lau Pa Sat for satay and Jalan Sultan for Malay/Arab food. This is a gem and i am glad i found it.

6.review_text: Location Hotel is located in the city with easy access to all the attractions. In addition to this there are many restaurants nearby and numerous shopping places too. Check in Hotel reception is located inside a restaurant so we had some issues to locate the reception and had to call them to ask for the location of reception. Rooms Room was bit small but it wasn’t a surprise because the check in staff had informed as at the time of check in.  I would recommend a room with Window if you are staying with your family.  Breakfast Breakfast was served at a eating place opposite to the hotel. It was a simple breakfast with limited options to chose from which was quite disappointing. Not sure they have the same setup before the COVID time or this is a temporary arrangement.

7.review_text: My family of four took this as the base for our 3D2N staycation over the National Day long weekend. The room, with the additional queen for the kids meant walking around the room was a little cramped but that was okay. Otherwise, it would have been quite spacious. The bathroom was roomy enough and, besides, we were mainly using this as a rest-stop between exploring the area and shopping.  The complimentary mini bar (of beers, soft drinks, coffee, tea and snacks) was a nice bonus and the bathroom amenities were also pleasantly bountiful. Overall, the room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  The customer service was very friendly and helpful and that was nice. The breakfast is across the street at Killiney and was both satisfying and filling.  NuVe Heritage is conveniently…

8.review_text: We booked the Explorer Suite for one night to commemorate our wedding anniversary. The room was quite spacious though a bit different from the photos. We were quite amazed that such a small place can packed so many rooms. This is a boutique hotel by the way.   The room is cozy enough for couples. I don't think it is suitable for families because the toilet door is translucent. The room was clean and comfortable. It feature a high ceiling and windows, a large TV with movie channel and a bathtub.   The plus point for this hotel is the location which is very central thus very convenient for you to move around and get to places. The large bathroom is also a nice touch for this room though people from the outside can see inside via the bathroom door. There is also a sliding door…

9.review_text: The rooms here are tiny. There’s not much more than just bed and shower.   We stayed here for two nights. Sleep was interrupted by fire alarms three times - and the staff claimed it was due to someone smoking in their rooms.

10.review_text: Strategically located near train stops, shops, restaurants and other tourist-friendly areas. The staff are very accommodating and friendly. They were able to answer my questions regarding best places to go to, nearest transport stops and convenience stores.   I highly suggest that you consider this place on your next visit to Singapore!

11.review_text: We had an excellent night at the Hotel NuVe Heritage before joining our cruise ship. The staff were very friendly, the room was excellent. The hotel is centrally located to the main sites, easily walkable or easy to jump on public transport if you preferred. Should we return to Singapore in the future, we will stay with you again, thank you.

12.review_text: Customer service is very poor. Got a message from the hotel right after booking at their website that if i book online, i could get early check-in &/or late check-out (subject to approval) for an hour. Checked with front desk when check-in & when he check on his end, he said that we could prolly extend for an hour but he ask us to call in front desk tomorrow instead to check again. When we called in the morning, called the front desk & a lady answer. Funny thing is after we ask her for a late check-out for an hour, she say that an hour cost $50. Then i was like but your website says we could get an extra hour check-out. So i check with her again about the complimentary 1 hour check-out, then she says in a rude tone with a disgusting attitude, if we want the complimentary late…

13.review_text: You can not beat the location of this hotel. Basically everything is around the corner. We didn't even need to use public transportation that much, walked everywhere most of the time.  There are several bars next door, a lot of massage places.  Bugis street where you can buy cheap last minute souvenirs is 10 min walk.  Quaint queen room was tiny. It  didn't bother us since we hardly spent any time at the hotel. But if you like comfort definately book a bigger room.

14.review_text: Just one night wasn't long enough. This place is a gem. Friendly and helpful staff followed by clean room and a comfy bed plus the nice touches about the place such as juice and biscuits in the Lobby and complimentary items in your room which makes your time here enjoyable.

15.review_text: I could close an eye if the front desk wasn’t smiling, but I would not comprise on overall cleaning standards of the room. I have been a regular to your hotels and would reconsider from staying here if the general cleanliness of the room was not met.

16.review_text: If you're a single traveller or a couple planning to spend most your day outside, this is a good option.   The rooms are on the small side, enough for only one suitcase, but sufficient.   The staff are friendly and the included stocked mini fridge is a plus.   The breakfast is across the the street in a cafe, there is only one continental option which could get a bit boring after a couple days if you are not into the local cuisine.  The location is great. 5 min walk to raffles hotel, plenty of malls around and 20 min to marina Bay.

17.review_text: When we searched for a quick stop-over, avoiding chains and corporates, NuVe popped on the radar. Quaint room, which it was, perfect for a very short stay. It is what you pay for, just a little bit better. 5 minutes walk to the Long Bar, this spot is perfect for city tours and exploring Singapore. FREE minibar was a nice touch, breakfast across the road ok, and really friendly staff.   We have marked this as a 5 out of 5 because of location, bed, clean room, and staff.  Tips. Make sure you book direct as they have some great deals available. When in Singapore, you must visit the Orchid Gardens and Botanic Gardens. We use the Big Bus Tour which was convenient. There is a nice little local restaurant around the corner with a constant queue which is worth a visit.

18.review_text: I stayed for two nights at Hotel NuVe Heritage with my two sisters for a family gathering, and our stay was an extremely enjoyable experience. The staff were attentive, friendly and were dedicated to making sure our needs were met. The Explorer Suite had a lovely atmosphere looking out to the other shop-houses in the street, was roomy and immaculately clean. There was a misunderstanding at the beginning of our stay regarding my presumption that if you book a hotel room for 3 people, more than one king size bed would be provided. This was dealt with calmly and professionally despite the fact that I was initially quite irritated. The lesson learnt was that if you have 3 adults, you need to specify that an extra bed is required and pay extra. Overall, a fantastic stay in a great…

19.review_text: I have visited this hotel before, and I am never disappointed. This time I stayed in the Artist suite, which is the room on the top floor of the building. I absolutely loved the open air bathtub on the terrace overlooking the high rises ! I will be back again.

20.review_text: This hotel had a good location with walking distance to the subway station to get to Marina Bay Sands and the Botanical Gardens  and close to all the main attractions of the city. The room was a little bit small but  the bed was comfortable and nice equitments. The staff is very friendly and helpful that make my stay enjoyable.

21.review_text: Stayed there for a business trip. the entrance quite confusing due to sharing with a restaurant. Very small room but free flow of the mini bar items. friendly staff. Breakfast using coupon at the opposite restaurant (kopitiam alike) but nice simple breakfast. walking distance to bugis junction area. I did not venture far, walking distance for beers and hawker type foods especially hainan chicken rice. about 1 km walk to arab street for muslim food

22.review_text: My wife and I were there staying in the explorer suite. The room was clean and the amenities were well prepare and good for the stay. This suite has a long corridor before reaching the bed area this allow us to be sleeping away from the door which has no noise  Good service staff and the partnership with killiney for breakfast was one of the best thing.

23.review_text: We arrived at Hotel NuVe Heritage at about midnight, and were a little bit confused as the entrance is through a restaurant, but someone was there to check us in.  We got a deluxe king room in order to get an outside window.  It was small, but clean, and the bathroom was a good size.  The included snacks and soft drinks were nice.  The location, right near Raffles place, couldn't be beat.  We didn't get the included breakfast, since there were so many places nearby to eat.

24.review_text: Location is great - walking distance to the subway station to get to Marina Bay Sands and the Botanical Gardens.  The room was small and the view from the window was towards another building in the back. I traveled solo so it wasn't a problem for me, but you may want to rethink if you are staying as a couple, or longer than a few days.  The front desk attendant was super friendly and provided great service.  The breakfast was simple, but good enough before starting your day.

25.review_text: I only had one night in Singapore and my appointments were at Suntec Convention Centre so I decided on this hotel. It was mainly due to the proximity to Suntec and the fact that the online photos looked nice.  I arrived at night so didn't really notice the hotel location until the next morning. It looked like a really nice small street with restaurants, cafes and bars and interesting shops as well. Too bad I didn't have time to explore. Perhaps next time.  The room I had was small. Reminded me of rooms I had in Paris hotels. So, if you're going to stay here, you'll need to manage your expectations. The stay was comfortable. I really liked the free mini bar. It's a totally new experience for me. The shower was good too. Nicer than some at the other Singapore hotels I've stayed…

26.review_text: NuVe hotel was brilliant - a lovely, well-equipped room, that provided FREE mini bar and even snacks downstairs. Excellent check in service and we also received a discount for the restaurant downstairs. No complaints whatsoever - affordable and in a lovely location. Would definitely stay again.

27.review_text: We stayed here for 4 nights in Aug 2019, really enjoyed our stay and can’t fault it really! Staff were great and remembered which room we were in every time we came back into hotel, which felt really personal.   Location - really well located 5 or so mins walk from both Bugis and City Hall MRT stations. Lots of places to eat, drink and shop nearby and around the corner from Raffles!  The Room - we had a Deluxe King Room on the 4th floor. It was a little on the small side, but to be honest was perfectly adequate for a city break where you’re not spending that much time in the room! Complimentary mini bar is a great touch, and we used it everyday. Bathroom is a decent size with a huge shower, however please do be aware that the toilet door is fully glass as well as the…

28.review_text: good central location near Raffles, well appointed rooms, bit small but bathroom was bigger, quiet. No pool like larger hotels but compensated for by great aircond and boutique style accommodation. Tremendous helpful staff that went beyond call of duty to assist. Free minibar included juice, pop & snackbars (beer only available to higher price rooms). Restaurant on ground floor but didnt try. but seemed well patronised . Good Hainan style eating options near by

29.review_text: when i am in singapore i will always stay at this lovely hotel because of the service that they provide the staff and the comfortable and clean room and everything is lovely as always. the location here is perfect for me to go to the malls. always look forward to stay here for our return in singapore.

30.review_text: Booked the Artist Suite for a one night staycation with my partner. Room is pretty! Toilet us clean. Some stains were found on the curtains, though.. and a few ants on the wooden flooring. But otherwise, beddings is clean and comfy! We loved the ambience at the balcony, with the fairy lights we could turn on for a more romantic feels while soaking in the outdoor bathtub.  Plus points would be the complimentary minibar (if I remember correctly there is a Tiger beer, too) and also the nespresso coffee.   Other than that, of course the location plays a part! It's situated close to Bugis MRT, and within walking distance to convenience stores, food places and also bars.  Overall an awesome stay.

31.review_text: Travelled to Singapore this time as a group of 7 so decided to try NuVe Heritage as we want to stay in Bugis/Bras Basah area.  Booked the Explorer Suite and 2 Quaint Queen. As we want 1 bigger room for all of us to hang out: * Explorer Suite: Very spacious, more than enough room for an extra bed even with their original King Bed.  Very nice bathroom, with smart toilet (nice bonus) ;) * Quaint Queen: Small but enough for 2 with Queen bed.  What deserved a special praise is their Front Desk staff. They are very attentive, always paid attention to everything we asked. They have great coordination between themselves, so when you asked for 1 thing to 1 person during 1 shift, rest assured a different person at the next shift would know all the details of your request and can give you…

32.review_text: Hotel Nuve Heritage is a great option if you are looking for affordable boutique hotel accommodation in Singapore that is really well located (Purvis Street).  Close to Raffles, good shopping precincts, and great restaurants.  Staff are incredibly friendly and considerate.  Reception is located behind a cafe, so don't be fooled by the address Jus enter the cafe and go through to the back. While you are there check out the stunning meals at Salted and Hung restaurant next door (run by a brilliant Australian chef).  Be aware that there are some rooms don't have windows for natural light and these are often featured in specials.  OK if you are keen to save money and are not spending too much time in the room during the day.

33.review_text: Had a great time staying here. I love the fact that the hotel is located near bugs junction,suntec city and raffles city. There is a lot of food along the street and the design of the room is just amazing.

34.review_text: The hotel is small: just six floors, with about 4-5 rooms per floor. To get to the hotel lobby, you have to squeeze past tables in the restaurant. During off-peak hours it’s just a minor annoyance, but during lunch or dinner hours, it’s a hassle – and the pathway through is fairly narrow. You’ll need to especially take care that any luggage you’re carrying does not smack in the restaurant patrons.   The location of the hotel – along Purvis Street – is great, with numerous eateries a plenty all within easy walking distance. There’s also two level basement carpark with perhaps three dozen lots at a building that’s a few minutes walk away, and it offers flat parking rates for public holidays and Sundays.  The hotel itself isn’t too old or at least looks like it’s gone through…

35.review_text: hotel with great location, close to all the main attractions of the city. very friendly staff and service. the first super comfortable room and the minibar is free, every day water and cold meats. 100% recommendation if you plan to travel to singapore

36.review_text: Love the free minibar in the room. Very cosy and clean room. Wifi worked great and staff were really helpful.  Many cafes near the hotel too and its only a 5 min walk to city hall mrt. Location of the hotel is excellent and we got free breakfast from website booking.

37.review_text: This was only for a one night stopover. Location was good and if you walk to next street be sure to visit the mint toy museum. Its fab. Raffles plaza shopping centre is close and plenty to do to keep us busy nearby. Check in smooth and very pleasant. Our room was tiny though....smaller than I expected and husband who is not small had to climb over me to get out of bed....not cool in the night, plus we are in our 60s. It was clean and a very basic breakfast of local and western food included. The street had some hip eateries as well as local cheap foods nearby. I recommend the room for single accomodation really. Staff pleasant. Complimentary mini bar too and snacks near lift. Good value for a boutique stay.

38.review_text: I stayed in hotel Nuve heritage for 8 nights with my family. It is very strategically placed. Arabian street, China town, little India, garden by the bay, Bugis junction, national gallery, asian civilisation museum are very close by. The rooms are small, but clean and all white. Breakfast spread is limited but good. You will get free bar refill with beer. :). Service staff are courteous. Not too many amenities. Bathroom doors are semi transparent, so had bit of inconvenience with a small kid. They have nice paintings for sale in the dining area.

39.review_text: I booked this hotel based on the good reviews.  This hotel should not be categorized as a 4* - from the lack of amenities to the condition and quality of the rooms - a 3* property at best.   Hot water showers seem to be a problem.  The towels/sheets were in sad condition, shower stall and floor were not clean. At check out they insist on inspecting your room ‘to see if you forgot anything’.   I booked a King premier room - the window was above the toilet and in the shower (ie useless), and the king size bed was a Singapore king (smaller than a Queen).   Breakfast in the lobby consisted of chicken nuggets, dry spaghetti, wieners, fried eggs, bread and sugar cereal.  Shockingly poor quality.   The staff are friendly but this hotel is not one I’d ever recommend.

40.review_text: Location is alright. In a little street that offers many local food options in surrounding streets and a 5-10 minute walk to Suntech City. The staff were lovely. The buffet breakfast was very mediocre/average - 3 hot items and cereal and toast, salad and one fruit. The quaint queen room was little but to be expected. Toiletry amenities were good. Clothes washing is expensive. The bathroom was fine but door opening made the shower difficult to access. Bed was very hard. Aircon great. Wi-Fi great. For what we paid, id rather spend a little more and get better.

41.review_text: First time visiting this hotel. One has to walk though the restaurant downstairs to reach the reception and the rooms. Our explorer suite was decorated nicely with free items in the minibar! The bathroom was exceptionally beautiful! The check in and check out was smooth enough. Our stay was very short - only few hours of an overnight stay, so we didn’t have the chance to experience more services.   Overall everything was nice, except our explore suite was right off the alley with traditional windows therefore soundwise it was a nightmare. Any sound in the alley is audible in our room. What’s worse, there were people chatting loudly and even singing karaoke downstairs nearby after midnight during our stay. I guess we were unlucky but this prevented me from a good sleep between…

42.review_text: first time to travel in Asia and glad to have booked here, the room is as described in the website so I had not so much expectations of it. It is neat and tidy and appreciate the little gestures this hotel did when I had my birthday. the hotel is very accessible to all tourists spots and you’ll always have a access to night shops around. had an awesome stay here!

43.review_text: This boutique hotel never fail to surprise me. From the reception up to our Quaint Room, everything is lovely as always, with a special and personal touch even to the small details you will feel you are always at home and welcome, always! Hotel Manager, Ms. Niezan is very attentive too like a sister. She handled our little issues very well, that's why I know I will be taken cared of whenever my husband and I do our business trip in Singapore. We are always looking forward top see the team's welcoming smiles here, always!

44.review_text: Location is definitely a plus if I may stress it out. Malls and amazing restaurant are nearby. We stayed at the Artist Suite and boy I am in awe of the bathroom design and the bath tub outside makes the Bali or Maldives feels! Mini-bar, free wifi, breakfast are worth it! Love the beds too! Although the air-conditioning is challenged by Singapore humid weather, we cannot be more happier with Mark at the front desk. As he has been more helpful in giving info of places to go and local food recommendations! We had the best stay and experience in Singapore with Hotel Nuve!

45.review_text: Small boutique hotel in a quiet street, 10 minutes walk to City Hall - the centre of town.Friendly staff, free smartphone w. unlimited free calls to the US and 4 other countries (and local) + internet, free (basic) mini-bar.Breakfast is basic.Very clean.

46.review_text: We had a great stay at Nuve. The customer service was outstanding. Thank you to Ridzwan, Mark and the team for their friendly service and making us feel so welcomed. Would recommend for the great location too.

47.review_text: We had a good stay at Hotel NuVe Heritage. Small but suitable room with free minibar (daily refill). Basic breakfast - more fruit, oats and cold cuts would be a good addition. Outstanding service and friendliness by receptionist Mark.

48.review_text: Nuvu is a lovely boutique hotel with all the amenities. It's a great location downtown, near many restaurants and just a 5min walk to the bus stop or train station. We enjoyed our stay here, the staff are very helpful and friendly too :)

49.review_text: Upon arrival (at 1 am, no less), was informed I'd gotten a free upgrade from a quaint queen to a king sized room, which was nice to hear. The room was pretty small even for a solo traveler, so I have to imagine it would be difficult to squeeze two people into an even smaller quaint queen. Staff were very friendly and responsive. Location was close to a metro stop and within walking distance (depending on your definition of walking distance) of many places. Didn't include breakfast with my stay, so can't comment on that. Overall, I feel like I got good value for the money, especially in Singapore, and would stay here again.

50.review_text: Really loved this all-white boutique hotel in City Hall. Only 5 min walk to city hall mrt and many good cafes in the area.  Room was really clean and comes with free coffee machine for use, snacks and drinks. All free! Breakfast was good too.  The bathtub in the suite room is huge and super relaxing. Will definitely try their other suite rooms in the future.

51.review_text: Room and outdoor tub was absolutely gorgeous. The Artist Suite was on the top most private floor. Easy access to main MRTs and Bugis and City Hall. Reception was friendly and easy to email them prior to stay for any questions. They were so kind to decorate the room for our anniversary. Free minibar was really nice to have too for snacks. Only thing was the bathroom floor gets super slippery as the water will leak from the shower area. Slipped and fell on my first night.

52.review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this small, elegant hotel. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've experienced anywhere, the bathroom pristine with a superb powerful shower.  As others have mentioned, the rooms are on the small side, however not a problem for me and on holiday in a city, the room is really only there for sleep.  Breakfast in the downstairs cafe was basic but more than enough.  Helpful friendly staff on reception made my stay really enjoyable.  Full marks from me.

53.review_text: This is a well priced hotel within easy walk of shops, restaurants, several of Singpore’s main sights and the MRT. Although the “quaint” queen room is on the small side, the room was clean and comfortable. Staff were great. The receptionist on duty last Saturday went to great lengths to help us secure an extra night’s accommodation after a flight delay saw us in Singapore for an extra day. Her efforts were greatly appreciated.

54.review_text: I stayed at this hotel during the last Christmas holiday. It is comfortable and these are what I feel about it:  Pros: - Good location. It isn't too near from the MRT stations, around 8 minutes walk to be exact from Bugis or City Hall stations. There are many eateries along the way though and there are shopping districts around. Hence, it's quite strategic.  - Free mini-bar. From Dolce Gusto capsules to soft drink, beer and snacks. They replenish daily. My favourite perk.  - Comfortable bed and clean house keeping. I got a few good night sleeps there.  - There is a cafe attached to it. Didn't try it though but it looks cozy and comfortable.  Cons: - Room space is a little bit small, compared to the rooms I stayed in other countries with the same price around Asia. Deluxe King…

55.review_text: The hotel was very clean room very small but comfortable. Breakfast waste off money not a very good choice and did not appricate getting woken up by reception to go down for breakfast. Hotel in a very good location and was nice boutique hotel instead if high rises hotels.

56.review_text: Stayed at this quiant hotel for 2 nights. Location and cleanliness are the hotel's greatest attributes. Staff are friendly and breakfast is okay. Overall had a nice and comfortable stay - will consider staying here again for future trips.

57.review_text: Very disappointed in our stay. We were initially checked into room 404 which stunk of paint and should not have been allocated to us. I asked for another room and we were moved to room 304. As we were travelling with our 11 month old son we were provided with a cot in the room. We were very annoyed that the cot was not put together properly and the bottom of the cot fell down. Our son hit his back when it fell and his still has a large bruise on his back. I couldn't believe that when I told the manager (Mark) he was very blase about it and his response was to say that previously children of up to 4 years of age had been in the cot without issue. He didn't seem to understand that if the cot is not put together properly it is dangerous and could have caused serious injury to my…

58.review_text: We were delighted our room got upgraded to the Artist Suite. Its like a mini penthouse that has a balcony and tub overlooking the city. We were impressed with the cleanliness, attention to details, comfortable bed, snack bar and the peace of the place.  Breakfast was simple yet just right.  Will definitely stay here again. Thank you for making our Christmas stay even more memorable.

59.review_text: Arrived (after 13 hour flight from UK) to find the suite I’d booked for three adults (with queen bed and single bed) had no single bed!!! I was told there was only one extra single bed in the hotel and that it was being used. So the three of us were expected to sleep in the one bed. Such bad service. No help at all in getting another hotel, and I had already prepaid so we just had to put up with it. Thank god it was only for one night. Would never stay here again!

60.review_text: Near a lot of bar resto, strategic place. clean room, nice staff. Full compliment even a free mini bar! The room is quite small but comfort for 2 people. AC is good no trouble. You can jogging nearby or even walk to the merlion park to workout there. Easly get grab here. Such a nice place!

61.review_text: This is my second time having staycation at this hotel. I love the location which is near Bugis Junction, Suntec City and Raffles City. There are lots of eataries along Purvis Street.  I love the Explorer Suite room. It is very spacious and there is a huge bathtub in the toilet. The minibar in the room is also free of charge and it will be topped up daily. The staff are also very friendly and helped with all our requests. Overall, we had a great stay. Thank you.

62.review_text: Clean, tidy, warming welcome, easy to access by walk. Location close to bugis junction and raffles city, with lots of local restaurant.  Also have the yummy own restaurant on 1st floor, very recommended for the food.

63.review_text: The hotel was in the centre in high street that is why we chose the hotel for a stopover plus the rating of FOUR STAR?  The room was too small for two people. The room can only accommodate a single bed but placed a double bed. If you are sleeping in the far end, you have to wake up the other person to go to the toilet. We traveled a lot but we never encountered such Inconvenience.   The breakfast was a very BIG disappointment. In every country you landed, the breakfast represent the breakfast of the country you are traveling, so you are enthusiastic what the Singaporeans have for breakfast. It was a complete disappointment again. The coffee was very COLD. The margarine instead of butter for breakfast was rancid. It taste  out of date. The cereals were hard and chewy instead of…

64.review_text: Great find this stylish boutique hotel. Even greater is the area - purvis street is refreshingly fun for walkmissions! Having tried all sorts of stays in Singapore over the past few decades we continue to seek where the locals go. Hotel is quirky enough, well thought out, not lavish but good quality. Such a delight. Highly recommended.

65.review_text: Not your first pick for business travel but it was a late arrangement due to cancelled flight. A very welcoming change :)  Warm staff who waited on me until 230am, very detailed and hospitable. They also got me a taxi booked in no time. I got the deluxe room with no window but didn't feel cramped at all. Toilet was spacious and had a bidet.  Minibar was ALL FREE not something you would expect. Wasn't able to consume. Everything though. They had 24hr snack bar at the lobby before elevator entrance. Breakfast was so-so but cant complain, just to fill your tummy.  Would visit again when on leisure.

66.review_text: My husband and I enjoyed our stay very much. Staff were friendly and obliging, lent us an umbrella and helped with ice and sympathy after a fall on wet and slippery pavement!  We had the smallest room and it was not roomy but perfectly adequate in size, good shower and coffee maker, free supplies and a fridge to put your water in. Comfy bed, nice breakfast, not extensive but fine and in a relaxed setting. Found nice bars nearby, always good!  Recommend Loof bar only a few mins walk away and Mikkeller couple of doors down.  We hadn't said anything about hubby's birthday during our stay, but on the day a card and lovely chocolates from management - a kind touch.  Well located for mrt and easy walk to many places.

67.review_text: Stayed here to reach the half marathon event nearby the following morning without fuss and enjoy the city in the night before. Located in such a great location. Boutique hotel, so don't look for amenities like gym, pool etc. The room was clean and compact. Good wifi, snacks on the ground floor. Decent breakfast buffet till 10am. But there are tons of great places for dinner, just even on that street alone. Expected it to be noisy, but was surprisingly quiet. Highly enjoyed my stay and recommend it for a couple enjoying being near the city attractions and shopping!

68.review_text: The Hotel is centrally placed,  being a three minute walk to City Hall MRT.  Rooms were clean and well appointed.  Breakfast wasn't ostentatious but well cooked and abundant.    Good selection of sensibly priced  bars and restaurants on the same street.  For me the key point was the staff.  Very friendly and helpful.    My one and only small complaint would be the lack of a full-length mirror which could easily be fitted to the inside of the wardrobe door.    As a reguar visitor to Singapore, but one who has always tried a new Hotel on each visit, I have already booked to go back.  Thanks guys.  It was a pleasure!

69.review_text: We stayed at Hotel NuVe for one night, during a stopover in Singapore. The highlights were: - excellent and friendly front desk staff; do this well, and many other things can be overlooked. - stylishly designed rooms, clean and comfortable. - well located; being on Purvis Street there are plenty of options for eating, and a relatively close to many other attractions. - Thanks for the early checking - that was appreciated! - The free minibar is an excellent innovation. It's not loaded with stuff, but we did not even get through half of what was in there.  However, being in Singapore, and in an older style building, the room was quite small. Organise yourself well, and it's not a problem.

70.review_text: Second time we stay here although the first time we stayed in a much bigger room. This time the hotel only had one room left (the small lead-in standard) and it was small (not as small as some Tokyo city hotels) however we did have to climb over each other to go to bed.  Highly recommend to upgrade to a bigger room if available and the standard one we stayed at is great for 1 person.  The hotel offers free minibar (replenished daily), and last time we had beer in the mini bar and this time we didn’t (not a beer drinker myself however if you are please check if it’s now included as it was before). Breakfast served from 7-10 am is simple but enough. The staff are friendly and very courteous and will assist with any query you may have. The receptionist called our room at 9:30 am to…

71.review_text: This is a lovely quaint hotel within a traditional shophouse, near to Raffles and the CBD, also within short walking distance of Bugis Junction mall and shopping streets. Staff was friendly, rooms are clean, there was a free mini bar in the room with soft drinks, beers which were replenished daily, also for chocolate & snacks.

72.review_text: we had booked the deluxe king room for my parents and they were very happy with it! the room was spacious and clean, it had interesting decorations. the toilet was clean and okay, the toiletries that were fitted in it was refreshing and had soft scents. room slippers and hair dryers are available also. it was a good stay thru out, coffee capsule selection was good too.

73.review_text: My friends booked the deluxe king room for a birthday celebration. It was spacious for all 3 of us plus a guest! There were drinks provided and snacks so our mini party was complete :) hotel staff was nice, they accomodated us when we requested for extra utensils and lighting up birthday cake candles

74.review_text: Really can't fault this hotel. The rooms are a little small but a lot of city hotels are as you are not expected to spend much time in the room! I stayed in the King room and had enough space, and the bathroom was lovely with a big shower. I thought overall the hotel had lots of character.  Loved the free mini bar and the wifi was good. Happy I chose to stay here instead of a bigger chain.  The location was great as I had one evening to see the sites

75.review_text: Stayed last weekend with my family and staff was accommodating when we made several requests (as we brought our infant along). Staff was kind and friendly, always ready to help. Rooms were clean, sheets - nice and crisp, very comfy. Will definitely come back again.

76.review_text: Would stay here again, free minibar, room clean, staff lovely and helpful. Breakfast nice.  Close to raffles shopping centre and bugis street markets.   Room quite small and could do with updating.   Cafe downstairs basic good food.

77.review_text: I booked the Explorer Suite for staycation over the weekend. The room is well decorated with full length window. There is even a bathtub in the spacious toilet. The staff is warm and friendly. The hotel location is very central. Only 5-10 min walk to MRT, Suntec city, Bugis Junction, City Hall. I will definitely be back to try out the other 2 suites.

78.review_text: I stayed here two nights and found the check in procedure easy although you have to walk through a cafe to find reception. Slightly odd.  Lift to all floors and room a good size for Singapore.  Decor done very well and minibar was complimentary. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was clean and well designed. No view from the window, well just a roof.  Breakfast was poor, if I stayed again I would go elsewhere for food.  Otherwise everything else was good. Great location, easy to explore Singapore. Walkable to Arab street. 3 stops on MRT to Orchard Road. Close to Raffles

79.review_text: Everything was perfect! Clean white room and toilet. Free minibar which inclusive of some snacks, soft drinks and snack bar.. Friendly staff.. They have a Cafe downstairs, I've never tried but it's always full of customers.. There's a lot of restaurants and bars nearby as well.. Recommended stay!

80.review_text: Simply one of the best and ‘away-from-the-crowd’ staycay. I’ve booked months before and the staff are relatively helpful and responsive to my request. As it’s for my anniversary, they outsourced balloons, chocolates, etc to make it best experience for us. Effort: 11/10 ! They even folded 2 swans out of a towel ;) Everything was done in details and I love how they make the effort to remember and call by our names. A shoutout to the staff , Mark and the lady who worked with him on 11/08/18. The only downside was that there’s no steamy hot water for the bathtub and there was a bad odor / stench near the sink / toilet bowl area. Overall, it was a splendid experience with much convenience to many places and food around the hotel :)

81.review_text: This boutique hotel was cosy and just nice for its price. The interior decor is beautiful. It was in a good location with a number of eateries around. However, the toilet floor gets wet every time we flush the toilet, so probably some plumbing work needs to be done, and the towels we used were moulting. Probably, the staff could defluff the towels so that the cotton doesn’t stick to the skin.

82.review_text: The Nuve Heritage hotel is lovely! I really enjoyed my stay. I was in town for work - the location is fantastic.   I had a premier room with no window - the room was spacious (bigger than is suggested by the photos online), luxurious and clean - the bathroom was particularly lovely. The room was nice and quiet, and I slept solidly!   A particular pro was how nice the staff are - I was impressed by how helpful and friendly they all are. The other bonus being that the mini bar (including snacks and beer) is free for every guest!  There is a 7/11 around the corner which is useful for amenities.  My only two minor points would be: there was no hair conditioner in the bathroom and as a vegetarian, I thought the buffet breakfast was very limited and not substantial. However, neither…

83.review_text: Booked a Queen room for my girlfriend's birthday and I put in a special request to write a card and place a bouquet of roses which I brought on the bed when we check in. The hotel's staff not only accommodated to my request, they even threw in a little "extra" to make our stay a truly memorable one.
