Big props to the front office reception on 5,6 and 7 July 2018 and the Guest Relations Officer for your gracious hospitality. We'll be back!   The room is simple but cosy, which I like. Clean and convenient to get around to the city. Lots of great restaurants and bars nearby, and the famous Haji Lane and Arab street isn't too far too.

84.review_text: We had a staycation in Explorer Suite, the room is beautiful, spacious and comfortable. The staff were very helpful! Location is superb with shopping malls and eatery within walking distance. Will definitely come back again!

85.review_text: Good room, good location. Was there for a staycation with my wife and it was fantastic. Love the suite. Clean, cozy and modern fittings. Suite was spacious and the bathtub was lovely. Good hotel for any kind of stay.

86.review_text: We stayed at NuVe Heritage in June this year on our way back from the Mediterranean. After a 15 hour flight, the welcome we received was very good. The staff were most helpful and only too eager to please. Very comfortable beds as well in this renovated hotel.

87.review_text: The room was clean and comfortable. It worth what we paid, with a super convenient location and high end services from hotel staff. I would definitely recommend my friends for this nice boutique hotel in town.

88.review_text: Stayed at this boutique hotel as it was close to Suntec Convention Center.  The hotel's location is good; quick 5 minute walk from City Hall/Esplanade MRT station. It was only a 20 minute taxi/Grabcar ride from Changi Airport - about SGD16-17 fare.  Quaint Queen room was small, but cosy. Parts of the room are in need of a repaint. Queen bed was uncomfortable; parts of the mattress had sunken in/depressed. Bathroom had see-through glass panels. It can be an uncomfortable shower experience if travelling with a friend. Toileteries provided were adequate-shampoo, body shower, dental kit, shaving kit, sewing kit, shower caps, soap etc. A Nescafe Dolce Gusto in the room and a stocked mini-bar at no extra charge was an added bonus.  "Mini-buffet'" breakfast was included. This was…

89.review_text: Hotel was in a great location, not far from Bugis Market.  The room, although small, was extremely clean. The bed was comfortable and the complimentary snacks, drinks and slippers were a bonus.  Breakfast was decent and varied each morning. Staff were friendly.  Overall I'd recommend if you want something reasonably priced and casual.

90.review_text: This boutique hideout in Purvis Street is a short walking distance to the train station and makes a good base to explore the city. Rooms are designed with a modern touch and comes with thoughtful amenities. Interiors are in neutral shades and crisp white furnishing for a clean look. During our visit, we stayed at the Explorer Suite that featured a marble-lined bathroom with top-notch toiletries including a TOTO automated washlet and massage shower. The highlight of our stay is definitely the plush Slumberland mattress, perfectly complemented by a firm duck feather and microfibre pillows.   Location is also perfect- it allows you to simply hop on the train station and get to many of the city’s must-see places in only a couple of minutes. Dining choices range from Michelin star…

91.review_text: Whilst we had a smaller room than our friend who was a solo traveler, the hotel was clean with excellent staff, free mini- bar daily replenished and the location was brilliant. Close to everything. Purvis after where the hotel is located has a range of great restaurants with our favourites being the French restaurant Saveur and the little Mexican restaurant. Will definitely stay there again when we return.

92.review_text: Back for staycation at Hotel Nuve Heritage after a year! The room is well maintained and cosy. Staff are as cheery. This time we get to have breakfast at their own cafe just at the lobby, which is even better than my previous stay. 😃  And, my sister is impressed with the complimentary mini bar and coffee machine. We will be back!

93.review_text: Hotel is located at a superb location! We are very particular about cleanliness and were more than happy with the room and bathroom. Hotel staff are very friendly and eager to help.  Would recommend this hotel to our friends.

94.review_text: hotel location is really good. took me just 3 min walk to city hall mrt station. if you want to walk to bugis mrt station its just 5 mins walk.  Stayed in their beautiful room and comes with complimentary minibar and dolce gusto coffe machine. The room i booked had a really nice bathtub and comfy bed.   Will again very soon!

95.review_text: Stayed for a night in the suite and had an amazing time.   The mini bar in the room is totally free and comes with really large bathtub. Room is really clean and the bed is comfortable.  The breakfast is great and it comes free when I book the room on their website.

96.review_text: Just one word of warning....if you’re thinking of staying at this hotel, then don’t! For us it has been a catalogue of errors from day 1. We booked 4 nights bed and breakfast after reading good trip advisor reviews about the hotel and it’s location. But simple things seem to be impossible for them to achieve.  Good points-good location, complimentary snacks in the room Bad points-the WiFi is horrendous, unless you’re sat downstairs right in reception by the router you won’t be able to use the internet full stop. The breakfast is shocking-basic is one thing but when they can only offer toast, cold scrambled eggs and garlic (yes garlic!) mushrooms, and a tiny bowl of yoghurt and a few pieces of fruit for the whole hotel it’s a poor show! I even asked for boiling water and I got a…

97.review_text: Located on quiet and pretty Purvis street, this hotel was a nice surprise during my last visit to Singapore. Ideally located (10 minutes walk from Raffle City), I stayed in a spacious, clean and nicely decorated room in the upper floors. Staff was friendly and efficient. Considering how pricey accommodation is in Singapore, I found rates very reasonable at his venue.

98.review_text: A very nice area Close to many things and a 20 min walk to china Town Nice room inspite now window great beds nice very service minded staff + you can eat in the entrance Negative is overpriced and mostly all Europeans have flights at midnite no luggauge room or possibility to take a shower or a late check out

99.review_text: Loved this hotel rooms a a little small but are lovely and white and very very clean. Great staff. This hotel is in a great location so close to raffles and public transport. Also close to the bay. Would upgrade next time and there will definitely be a next time loved Singapore. This hotel has some great bars nearby. Breakfast is small selection but good.

100.review_text: Above a trendy cafe in a gorgeous street very close to Raffles (or the building site that was/will be Raffles). However, our room was very small. We asked to move but they couldn’t organise anything until the manager arrived several hours later. As we were only there overnight wasn’t worth it. After a 12-hr flight we felt very constricted and didn’t have enough room to open both our cases at the same time. Bed squashed against wall so one of us had to crawl across the other to get in and out. Definitely over-priced and our room definitely not 4-star by any means. Breakfast was meagre.

1.review_text: Howard, Daryl & Bella were very hospitable. They went all out to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel was clean and the room-feel was great. There were dining vouchers which handy as we used then at Ginnett restaurant. Overall, very pleased with the stay!

2.review_text: Staffs Daren and Bella were very helpful when serving my boyfriend and I whenever we had enquires about the room. They would strike up conversations about our stay and how they could improve better, once the feedback was given, immediate action was taken to ensure that we had a pleasant stay at our room.   However, the bathroom lights were tripping most of the time and even after servicing the lights, it still went out the next day.

3.review_text: Did a staycaytion using the rediscover voucher and it was very worth it!! Stay came with breakfast for 2 (set menu) and also $50 nett dining credits!! The room was relatively spacious and clean for the money we paid, and basic amenities were in the room too! Just note that there's no fridge though..   Special shout out to Yvonne who aided us in our check in and made the process very smooth! We would also like to thank Daryl and Bella as well for always greeting us warmly and made us feel at home whenever we approached them at the front office.  Would definitely recommend coming to stay at the hotel, and I would be back for another staycay! ♡♡♡

4.review_text: The location is perfect as well as it's right by the center of town. Next to a museum and art school, 10mins walk from the shopping and entertainment district, a cinema, library, etc. Also near to MRT station (downtown line).

5.review_text: I had an amazing stay at the hotel. Special thanks to Howard and Bobby who have always ensure we have comfortable stay throughout the entire stay. We felt very welcome from the moment entering hotel, and Daryl who assisted us with the check in. Thank you!

6.review_text: Had a great stay experience at Hotel G! The location of the hotel is great as its surrounded by major MRT line like Bencoolen, Rochor and Bugis. There's many food options around the hotel as well.   Warm greeting by Howard once we stepped into the hotel lobby and he offered us umbrella as its raining. Check-in process assisted by Daryl was smooth, quick and professional. Bobby at reception was so helpful and patience to assist our questions and enquires.  The room interior design are cosy makes us feel comfortable even the room size is a bit small.   Make a reservation earlier if you wish to dine in at Ginett as they are always fully book. Also, do not miss out their 1 for 1 deals for beers and sides from 3pm-7pm at 25 Degrees Burger, Wine & Liquor Bar as well!   For the price…

7.review_text: Very compact room and comfortable bed to sleep. Location is so convinient. I love the turkish food just nearby the hotel. Entrance staff at the main entrance near the restaurant is so friendly. Check in is fast too.

8.review_text: Check in was smooth even at 6pm. Room is great sized. What made things great is the cleanliness. Fast express checkout. Nothing seems to be a missed. We like it! Thank you Bobby for the warm welcome! :)

9.review_text: Thoroughly impressed with the professional customer service provided by Daryl from check-in service to providing ice to the room personally. Even with the long snaking queue at check-in, Daryl went above and beyond, maintaining a professional attitude. Would totally come back here again for the service provided! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Once again, customer service has exceeded expectations, even better than some of the 5-star hotels in Singapore.

10.review_text: Always a great choice for a staycation. Second time here and still very happy with the professional and swift help. Special mentions to Daryl, Shaun and Bobby for the awesome service and for getting the room ready for us in such short notice.

11.review_text: Really enjoy the comfortable vibes of the hotel and staff here. Very friendly and caring staff; second time here and not disappointed one bit! Big shout out to Daryl, Shawn and Bobby! Awesome service guys!

12.review_text: Tbh I don’t find the room too small as I’ve stayed in smaller. It’s OK for SG standards, where space is priced at a premium. The room is cleverly designed to maximize space while allowing you to feel cozy without feeling too claustrophobic. There’s space under the bed for luggage, and enough room for a small table for working travellers. Rooms feel quite well-maintained. Checkin and out was fast and efficient. And there’s so many food options in the area. Would stay at again!

13.review_text: I am not so fussy when commenting. I like G hotel overall. Good customer service during check-in and the receptionist is good and helpful. Very comfortable and clean hotel.   Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!

14.review_text: I will stay in Singapore for several days then go to the United States. I have a very good impression of Singapore and very efficient clerks, government officials and good drivers and hotel steps. A nice trip.

15.review_text: enjoyed my stay. good location. helpful reception staff. Bobby assisted me with directions around the hotel.  will want to come back again. very beautiful country.  will recommend my family to stay here

16.review_text: Very good stay love the ambience service was quick as well. There are good food nearby. Was upgraded to a Good Room King too. Friendly staff was there to help at   possible when there was an issue......................

17.review_text: Its myy first time here and i love the interior..  superb !! Bella was so helpful and patience w me .. after many months of not having staycation. Todayy i had my 1st staycayy w my fiance and i tend to be abit lost and clumsy but it wass all in place w the help of the team . I love the concept of the room.  Ecspeciallyy the pinboard.  It looks cool..  Basicallyy i love everything!!! And Bella , thankyou for service. Thumbs up to you ! I will prollyy come back again ! Kudos team !

18.review_text: Had a great stay experience with my friends at Hotel G! 😊 Despite my immobility, the staff paid extra attention to me during my stay by checking on me. The staffs were very friendly & hospitable! Special thanks to Daryl, Ana, Hema & Yvonne for taking care of me & my friends. Would definitely revisit !

19.review_text: Had a great time with my friends at Hotel G, staff are friendly and patient. Would like to thank Daryl, Ana, Hema and Yvonne for making our stay a memorable one and being so accommodating with our requests! ☺️

20.review_text: An overnight getaway with our parents @ Hotel G. Very aesthetic, modern feel rooms. Enjoyed the overall guest experience.  Special thanks to Shyidah, Shawn, Kiren and Rave at Ginett Dining Place.  Grateful for your heartfelt service!

21.review_text: Special thanks to Daryl, Ana, Hema and Yvonne for making my stay so enjoyable 💯 they went the extra mile when me and my friends had special requests. They were very accommodating, friendly and professional!

22.review_text: Would like to comment Daryl, Ana, Hema and Yvonne for being spontaneous for the video filming! Check-in was seamless and fast. They were also hospitable and friendly! I wouldn’t mind going back again!

23.review_text: Pre my arrival , the hotel gave me very detailed instruction on the materials required for check-in as an international tourist. Quarantine was well organised with all information provided in the room.  Room is quiet, clean and stylish,The location can't be any better, surrounded by lots of food places and is very close to Bugis Junction. The staffs at the reception are very helpful and friendly. In general I had a great time there!

24.review_text: Had a marvelous experience staying at Hotel G from 5 March to 7 March and celebrated my birthday in Hotel G for the 2nd year!  This year was just exceptionally good!  First up, during our check-in, the staff, Hema was the one assisting us and she was very attentive and provided us with 2x complimentary drink vouchers at Ginett. Seeing that i am a guy with size (6'5) and together with my girlfriend, she managed to upgrade us to a room with King bed size. Appreciate her wonderful service to us.  Next up at the restaurant, Ginett, we were attended by the staff, Eugene. As i was celebrating my birthday, my girlfriend wanted them to prepare a birthday surprise for me and they went above and beyond and took it one step, better than expected. they gave us a over the top bird cage…

25.review_text: Good service, fast housekeeping, concierge staff was very helpful!  Complimentary parking, champagne & 2 free burgers per room during the stay which was nice!  Gave a complimentary upgrade since we wanted side by side 2 rooms  Overall would recommend, 10/10 service! :-)

26.review_text: We had our 26th Anniversary staycation here. Hotel is clean, friendly and helpful staffs😍. Well done Daryl and Shawn👍👏👏👏 The Wagyu beef at Ginett Restaurant was so good😋 We'll definitely come back again 😍

27.review_text: The good: Very warm hospitality, & not to mention the awesome food at Ginett. All worth the money & time spent!  The less good: the pillows are like prata, way too flat! Also, they ought to raise a ledge in the bathroom to separate the shower area, otherwise water flows out to the toilet area. Lastly, windows are very dirty!

28.review_text: Had a great stay. From the lobby all the way to the reception and the staff around are so friendly, welcoming and nice.  Rooms are super comfortable, the bed especially. Had a much needed good sleep the whole stay and the breakfast was really good too.   Thank you so much for the much needed rest and the nice friendly voices.

29.review_text: Booked 3 rooms in total for my birthday, parent's anniversary and my 2 sisters for staycay. We were greeted and checked-in by Ana and Fathin. We had requested something special for my parent's room, and they prepared rose petals and towel swans. They were perfect. Was told that Shawn was the one who prepared it. The rooms were clean and looked so instagram-able. The layout is simple yet has a hint of elegance. We had a pleasant night with comfy mattress and sheets. At check-out, Daryl attended to us. He ensured we had a great stay, which we did.

30.review_text: Will hotel G was quite an experience, first let's talk about the good things.  A) Amazing location - the hotel is very close to the bencooleen MRT station, it's also connected by bugis and rochor, so it's super central to everything.   B) everything is in the vicinity - you have a 24 hr thai restaurant under the hotel, you have the hotel's burger joint and a fancy restaurant called ginett under the hotel, there are about eight 7/11s and 2 fair price supermarkets close by. You have several vending machines and you can walk it down bencooleen for a late night drink... You also have Gokul which is an Indian restaurant across the street.   C) you have bella as an attentive amazing and super help at the hotel... She leads the front office and she is the nicest person ever - always…

31.review_text: I waited for more than 1.5 hours for living. It is so interesting that the hotel always told me that there is a room for me but I cannot live. During the 1.5 hours, the hotel only give me a cup of water.

32.review_text: Great promotions on Hustle & Grind, now I can work peacefully without the noise of my little ones. The hotel is so cozy, clean and comfortable. Love the food and I just had snacks yet and look forward to my lunch, afternoon snack and wine...  If you are having important meetings, events and a need to have a refreshing change of environment. This is a perfect place to work from hotel. Very innovative way to continue to serve others.  I like how they made Social distancing marks so fun and creative  Most importantly for an ex-hotelier and business owner like me, Amazing service, I feel like I am home :-)

33.review_text: Love the ambience and the atmosphere of the room despite its room's small size. Cos it's at Bencoolen MRT station, easy to go Bugis, Boat Quay, Orchard. Shout out to the reception lady, Ana. A very friendly personnel, gave us free upgrade from queen to king bed.

34.review_text: Perfect location for a staycay! You would be spoilt for choice with the variety of food nearby. Or if you're feeling lazy, the burger bar and restaurant downstairs are great options as well. Do yourself a favor and plan your next vacation in this hotel! I promise you would not regret it (:

35.review_text: Bella at the reception is extremely cooperative and such a joy to served by! Knowing it is a surprise birthday celebration, she played along with the surprise while checking in for the birthday girl and also gave us complimentary welcome drinks!:) Overall very amazing experience staying in Hotel G and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

36.review_text: Room size is fit for solo traveler The room is clean and cozy, quite comfy as well I love the room decoration, so nice  Not so expensive and quite valuable in Singapore!!! Would possibly stay again next time!!! Highly recommend

37.review_text: I’m not one to write reviews but my stay at Hotel G deserves this exception. Our stay on the 16/2/2021 really went beyond our expectations.   From the very minute we stepped into the lobby, we were constantly greeted with a smile, which really just brings that warm feeling back , especially in this covid-19 climate.  Throughout our stay, Daryl took the initiative to personalise our stay, ensuring all our needs and wants were met!  Hotel G, as simple as the name sound is well on its way to being a top notch flagship in the hospitality industry, with its well trained staff, modern furnished look and attractive marketing.  Kudos to the HR team For maintaining and training up their staff!   We will definitely come back to Hotel G and would recommend our friends to this hotel as well!

38.review_text: Great hospitality, simple room yet cosy and very clean. Definitely will recommend.. Thank you Daryl for your great hospitality! Look for Daryl should u need anything!! Your warmth and great disposition made my day stay with hubby memorable. Thank you!!

39.review_text: It’s my second time back in this hotel. Amazingly clean and comfortable. Tho it’s 45 mins waiting time for check in. Faithin was so good at what she was doing and gave her best service. Thank you so much!

40.review_text: Recently went to try Hotel G and it was amazing. When i got there i was served by bella and she was fast, friendly and helpful. She made sure i didnt wait long for check in as i was with my child. When i went into the room, the room was in very good condition. I would definitely stay here agin and recommend it to others.

41.review_text: Stayed here for a staycation and found the place to be nice, clean and cosy room, great service. Value for money. Great restaurant and food options around. Rooms are a little on the small side but I enjoy the cosiness.

42.review_text: Celebrated my anniversary here and Elvis and Nana were really amazing from the pre-arrival all the way to the check in.   I wanted to arrange something for my partner prior to check in, and was offered a celebration package by Elvis. Nana then took over after a while, and spelt my name correctly (very important to me) after her other front desk colleague spelt my name wrongly. Nana was very personable and let me know everything I needed to know during check in. When I reached the room, I was pleasantly surprised to receive a courtesy call from her too.   We were upgraded to the great room and the atmosphere in the room was beautiful! The celebration package Elvis offered comes with decorations and a $50 ginett voucher. (Ps. I moved away the celebration box because I placed my…

43.review_text: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel G, which is situated near Bugis Junction. Room is clean and amenities are provided. Would also like to thank Riza for being so helpful! Would definitely recommend Hotel G to anyone whose looking for a nice staycation.

44.review_text: Hema was helpful and nice when a booking error was made. She advised what steps to take and promptly corrected the dates of the stay! She also further upgraded our stay to made the stay more memorable.

45.review_text: I purchased a Work from Hotel package with overnight stay recently, having stayed there for a staycation before and enjoyed it. However, the experience this time was not so enjoyable. The plusses were that the front staff were courteous and professional during check in, the hotel itself was quiet with strong wifi for working, and the breakfast was very filling and delicious. However, not all the perks listed on the package were given, such as the morning and midday snacks. The fresh juices were nice, though.  I encountered very mixed service at Ginett  restaurant where I tried to use the lunch and drink voucher given as part of the package. The front manager was polite and reminded me to check in with the TraceTogether App, and I had enjoyed the food. Yet... I had asked for the…

46.review_text: Always love staying at Hotel G - it's a wonderful boutique hotel with many unique quirks and hidden gems around the area. Room is clean and smells great, staff are always friendly and helpful.   For late night owls, there's a open air Thai restaurant just downstairs of the hotel , and Wan Wan Thai Cafe serving bingsu desserts till 3am everyday! It's also near shopping areas like Bugis and Dhoby Ghuat. A secret tip - there's a game at the lift where if you spot the differences, you get a free wine from the bar downstairs ;) I would definitely come back to stay again with Hotel G!

47.review_text: Second time staying here, always very intrigued by the giant dream catcher in the room. However, the dream catcher in my room this time was a bit uglier and plainer than the first (the first had feathers).   Room wise, it’s an affordable stay hence room size is small. It’s still manageable even though the bed is fitted tightly at the corner which means one of the guests would have a hard time going to the toilet in the middle of the night.  Service wise, we had a warm welcome by manager Darryl, a much kinder greeting than our first stay. He allowed us early check in, likely since it was a Friday so there might have more available rooms. Late check out of 30 mins extra (12.30pm) was also given when request was made. Quite impressed as this hotel was willing to accommodate when…

48.review_text: my hubby loves the big ceiling shower & the ceiling dream catcher.. very nice design! I shall give a 5 stars for the overall of the room!  Good King Bed is very comfy that i almost fell asleep & facilities wise are are overall excellent as well. it will be prefect if there's a mini fridge for us to chill our drink as today is a humid weather..  Love the location as it's just next to Sunshine Plaza where my hubby can go to his favorite Gundam Store.. And i can easily access to the Guan Yin temple jus a few mins walk away.. there's a very nice thai restaurant below the hotel building. (:

49.review_text: I received warm welcome from Front Office Manager, Daryl.  The front office team was friendly and bubbly.  When I got into the room, within minutes, I received a call from the front office to check if everything is fine.  The food at the restaurants were nice and hotel guests are given 15% discount for dining in. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice staycation.

50.review_text: Positive Hotel is clean and comfy. Good stay overall.  Negative Poor communication between staff at reception. Extended late checkout timing but probably wasnt convey between staff and came calling and knocking to verify check out timing.

51.review_text: Had a really delightful stay at the greater king room with outdoors this weekend. Daryl, Fathin and Hema were really hospitable and welcoming. The room was clean and big, and thankfully there was no rain that day so we managed to utilize most of the outdoors. The only downside is that the indoor TV only allows for android devices to connect.

52.review_text: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived early just to drop off our bags and were told that we could check in ahead of schedule. Special shout out to Daryl at the front counter for arranging this. He was very helpful and professional and gave us a very good first impression of the hotel. We really love the unique decor that gave the hotel a lot of personality. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Thank you Hotel G for a memorable stay!

53.review_text: Stayed a night at G Hotel on a Saturday. Was greeted and served by Bella. Genuine and professional, she clarified my doubts with ease and made me feel very welcomed to the Hotel. Check-in was smooth, quick and easy. Even got a free upgrade to the king size bed room.  Room is small but it is cozy and clean. TV channels were limited but it has an HDMI input to stream your laptop or other devices. Hotel location is convenient with many food outlets available in the vicinity. Only downside to the room is that there is no mini bar fridge.   Overall, very happy with my stay. For the price point it highly exceeded my expectations. Will definitely visit again!

54.review_text: Bought the package through klook for christmas with a decent price. Design of hotel is very modern and very accessible to amenities and food places. Had a pleasant stay with great service as their staffs are very friendly and accommodating. Patience in responding to our request are what the makes the stay very pleasant.

55.review_text: The greater room exceeded my expectations in all aspects! Room comes with a super cool balcony great for chilling! Service is fast too when requesting for ice, towels, bottle openers! Great value 10/10

56.review_text: Great hotel. With great cleanliness and overall set up. Space and atmosphere was cosy. Amenities provided were more than sufficient.  Front desk service was very friendly and willing to go the extra mile to make things more comfortable.

57.review_text: The receptionist, Bella, did a great job serving me! Good first impression, looks neat. will definitely stay here again! Walking distance from Bugis, easy access. Price is reasonable and room is tidy, clean and chic!

58.review_text: Big shoutout to Ana for handling my check-in swift and hassle free！  And thanks Ana and Daryl for the handwritten note!   The min I step into the hotel, I feel welcomed by the staffs.  The rooms is pretty spacious given that the space is limited. It was a quiet space and allows me to work in the morning/evening.  The hotel have a few restaurant downstairs and is pretty close to train station.  I highly recommend you to come and stay with G Hotel regardless of solo, with friends or family.  Its a great experience!

59.review_text: Went in for a long awaited staycation and was greeted by Bella. Her bubbly self and vibrant personality made it easier for us to communicate and had fun during the check in process. She also accommodated when I requested for a late check out till 3pm without charge!! Thank you for the great experience Bella! You definitely left an imprint in Hotel G ☺️

60.review_text: Friendly staff Bella & Fathin.  Central to popular singapore attraction. Some walking distance and for others.  MRT is close by and bus stops are nearby as well.   Room clean and modern.  Price is very reasonable for this location.

61.review_text: Stayed at Hotel G again recently and I must say that the overall experience was an excellent one.  Duty manager, Daryl Goh attended to us at check-in was approachable and friendly in demeanour. He was knowledgeable, meticulous and systemic in the check-in process and safety checks. The expedient and systemic check-in process facilitated concurrency of activities and minimised waiting time for guests, and the build-up of any queue at all.   Not the first time a staying at Hotel G and I must say Hotel G’s rooms are consistently clean and well maintained. Staff are proactive and helpful, and it’s always a comfortable experience!   p.s. Do book with the current burgers in bed promo which is amazing!

62.review_text: This is my Nth time visiting Hotel G and since day 1, i always have pleasant experience here. Unlike my other staycations here in Singapore, i do not have to deal with issues on cleanliness, service and thoughtfulness of the staff. Being particular about cleanliness, i always do a check on hotel room’s cleanliness by wiping down surfaces with strong disinfectant wipes. Of the multiple visits here in Hotel G, i found my wet wipes remain unstained. Kudos for the consistency.   Good Crowd management, customer service experience and thoughtfulness of the staff can be felt from the entrance to the concierge; even along the corridor when i bump into the staffs. During this stay, Daryl the duty manager check us in within a short span of time and ensured our stay was comfortable and…

63.review_text: I love the hotel. had a one night stay here and I've got to say, im impressed with hotel G. the ambience, room deco and friendly staffs are fantastic! I would like to highlight abt daryl as he assisted me with my check in and accommodated to my needs. thanks daryl! & thanks hotel G :) would love to stay here again (:

64.review_text: Its a really pretty dreamcatcher on the ceiling that made me drawn to this room and the hotel aesthetic is on point and first impression does not look dodgy at all :) i love how they make use of every space and inch of the room to maximize hotel occupancy rate! Good job in designing

65.review_text: We had a wonderful stay with Hotel G.   Special mention to front desk managers Daryl and Bella. Praiseworthy services from both of them and the rest of the hotel staffs.  Dinning at in-house restuarant Ginett was excellent as well.  We will be back.

66.review_text: Daryl & Bella who attended us during check in and check out is so friendly, make us feels so good celebrating our 5 years anniversary. The voucher we got we purchase the desserts menu from Ginett Restaurant and my godness is so delicious!! Will come back for the hospitality and excellent dessert! Thank you!

67.review_text: The room is so compact, it's a tight squeeze for 2 adults. You have to literally climb onto the bed to plonk yourself into the other side. The wash basin is just outside the shower and toilet. There's no wardrobe, just an open hanger with 4 hangers to hang your clothes. A kettle with complimentary coffee/tea bags on a tiny desktop leaves no space to place your personal accessories like phones, jewellery, etc.  Breakfast is the standard western fare or chicken congee, with a cup of cut fruits and croissants. Service is efficient, though you have to ask for butter if you want it with your croissants.  Hotel G is a conveniently located near to MRT stations Rochor/Bencoolen. It's just opposite Fortune Centre and Sunshine Plaza, so food options are aplenty.

68.review_text: My first time staying in Hotel G and it was amazing! its an affordable hotel and the service was beyond expectation. Even though the room was small, it felt very cosy due to the decorations and the ambience of the room. The good Queen room can accommodate not more than 2 people.  Don't expect much as this is not a 5 star hotel.   The front desk officer name Bella was very calm in handling guests. Especially it was the peak time for check in. Also, it was on a new year and they were full house so we had to wait for our rooms to be ready for check in. Understood that they try their level best to accommodate to their guests.  Waited for about 1.5 hours to finally check in. We were tired from walking around and it was raining heavily, so we were glad that there was someone to assist…

69.review_text: Though the room is small, it is clean and the decorations are nice. Wifi is good. Free parking is also available. Lots of food options are available nearby. Customer service is not bad. Good for a short staycation at affordable price.

70.review_text: We would like to show our compliments to the staff who handled us meticulously, Daryl. He helped us with process of checking-in efficiently and handled our queries professionally. He is truly an asset to the organisation. We can feel his sincerity, genuineness as we observe him handling other customers with the same care. Truly amazing. My boyfriend and myself come from the service-line, we know how difficult situation can be, especially now. Thank you for serving everyone, and going the extra mile for your guest. We are very pleased and would return definitely.

71.review_text: It’s a really clean and comfortable stay at Hotel G. I would specially like to mention Shawn from the Front Office for helping us expedite the check-in processes and also Housekeeping Shah for efficiently attending to our late night request for miscellaneous items such as more towels and water. Overall it’s a really pleasant stay and we would definitely visit again!  Chong

72.review_text: I am very impressed the whole hotel was designed and highly praised the service quality of each staff during this tough times. They were very professional and worked hard to ensure each guest has a pleasant and enjoyable stay,  They were truly friendly and helpful. They smiled and greeted guests with their hearts and ready to provide a helping hand.  The room and location of the hotel was excellent. Love it. Kudos to all staff.

73.review_text: The stay was short but enjoyable. Check-in was smooth & fast. The gentleman who attended to me was friendly & attentive.  Room was pleasant & the design was slick as well as modern.   The only issue is the cleanliness of the aircon vents. Quite dusty.  Toilet was clean.   Simply love the location and few minutes walk to Bugis Plus.    Upon returning to the hotel, the friendly hotel staff attending to our temperature & safe entry checks.   Please note that the laundry and slipper bags are charged at a nominal fee. Would suggest to provide another alternative option if guests were to do their own laundry back home (i.e. paper bags for laundry if environment friendly option is a concern to do plastic bags).   Check out was fast as I did Express Check out. The hotel should consider…

74.review_text: Staycation gone wrong. Rooms are not soundproof. If you have neighbours beside u in the next room, u can practically hear their talking and laughing.  Ceilings also has this creaking contracting sound at night. Could be due to the wood or tiles. If some1 is staying above u , u can practically hear the chair shift n their heavy steps.  As much as we try to keep it simple & enjoy this staycation, we were rudely awoken at 12.30am till 1.30am by the next door neighbours grp of 4 giggling, laughing, incessant chatting till we couldn't take it and called concierge.   Security guard found there were 4 ppl in the room instead of registered 2 person. Makes u wonder how lax security is. I went over to tell them off as the security does not seem to impose any authority. Disappointing to…

75.review_text: I was there with my bestie for a work-cation on a Friday. Room was small but cosy. They provided us 2 plates of pastries for morning tea (maybe cuz our room was double occupancy), lunch with a glass of wine and another plate (only 1 this time) of sandwiches & waffles for our afternoon tea break. Thankful for the fruit juices, canned drinks and water provided in the minibar, tea and coffee was also available.   Service at check in was quick and friendly.   Overall a very worth it package, we will be back! ✌️😁

76.review_text: Me and my family stayed here for 9 nights and we enjoyed ourselves alot. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended. We went to both restaurants to try the food and it was delicious. Once again, thanks Joyce for arranging for me.

77.review_text: Location nice, staff helpful too. But the rain shower didn't work, hot water kettle had dirt, one of the glasses was dirty (dried toothpaste I think?). We booked a package with Klook, which promised a free Champagne but the champagne given was not the one stated in the package, which I would have preferred. I've attached the photo of the advertised v. actual with this post.   Still, give 3 stars because the package came with $50 dining vouchers and I really enjoyed the restaurant Ginett below, and the package was still considerably value for money. Unfortunately, the multiple minor disappointments added up and prevent me from giving any stars higher.

78.review_text: Checked in: 16 Nov 2020 Checked out: 17 Nov 2020  Booked a staycation for the mentioned dates and informed the hotel we needed the wheelchair accessible room. Unfortunately, it was not available on the day we arrived. We were informed about 1 hour before we checked in.  Room was interesting except the pillow was terrible, really flat pillows.  Was thankful and appreciative of Mr Rahimi who was at the level one counter. He helped a lot with the lift. Especially since he had to

79.review_text: check in on a friday. it took about 45mins to reach our turn for checkin. room was decent and extremely cosy. water refill was not allowed during covid period. so room service to deliver water to our room was available. breakfast was ok. surrounding area good for shopping and eating.. near dhoby area. walkable distance.

80.review_text: Checked in on 19 Dec 2020. Took a shower and decided to take a nap. However there was a musty smell coming from the bed. We thought that it was from the duvet and requested to change the cover. The cover was changed but the smell came back. It must be the duvet then. Informed reception and they advised that housekeeping would change the whole duvet and send us some water too.  Water was sent to us but the other request was not passed to the housekeeping. Explained to the housekeeping staff and she brought us a new duvet. We must compliment the housekeeping staff as she was really courteous and nice throughout the entire ordeal.  With the new duvet, we thought our worries were all resolved. Alas, a few minutes later, the smell was back. This time round, we decided to sniff for…

81.review_text: Normally I would not book hotels through Klook but I did so to utilise the Singapore Rediscover voucher.   The hotel is actually quite small but it has a hipster theme. (Reminds me of the Papa Wale hotel in Taipei)  For the price I paid, its value for money for Singapore standards. Nice and clean but its a tiny room. If you pay slightly more, you can opt for M Social on Klook and get a bigger room.   Pros: Nice and clean but really no facilities in the hotel. Eateries near hotel and Bugis is a 5 min walk. The service staff was prompt in her emails, etc. Excellent service overall...  Cons. The sink in the room is tiny, the pillows need to be thicker, the carpark entrance confusing.

82.review_text: Everything was good and fast check-in although I have difficulty communicating due to masking that I couldn't see their lip-reading instead of showing them via mobile texting. I would like to appreciate Belle's customer service to take initiative by leading me to my hotel room. The room is just right for solo or couple to settle down and everything is clean especially the toilet which I'm concerned about the most. Well Done... I will definitely stay here again in the future.

83.review_text: Was very impressed during the checkin especially with Ana, she was very polite, friendly and quick! Raven from Ginett restaurant was great as well too, she was calm and composed even though the restaurant was swamped. The room I was in was quite small so I’d advise claustrophobic people to take note of this. However it’s a great deal with its price and location with good eats around the area.

84.review_text: ants crawled onto bed and there were a lot on the table that got onto my stuff. also had a couple flies in the room which isn’t the most pleasant. other than that, service is great, reception is very helpful and room cleaning service is excellent (replaced water and toiletries). room is a little small but good for couples or small groups. bed is big and very comfortable

85.review_text: The location of the hotel is a few minutes walk away from the MRT station. The stay was pleasant as the service was good.  Requested for a change in the room as the wind was hitting onto the external facade too loudly, and the reception immediately helped us with it.  Breakfast served at the 25 Degrees cafe was awesome as well. The waitress by the name Abigaile was really helpful and friendly towards us.  Overall, an awesome experience!

86.review_text: Great location in the city/town area where there’s abundance of food available. Greeted with excellent service by Daryl Lim at the front desk when I arrived. He was very quick with our administration.   However a little disappointed on the room size, it was not as spacious as it was shown in the picture. There wasn’t much TV channel available as well.   Do note that there’s only 1 complimentary parking for an exit so I do not advise you to drive there as parking is pretty expensive. $1/30 mins for weekdays and weekends. It would be great if Hotel G is able to look into this.

87.review_text: smooth check in , spacious room , good locati wason at middle rd , with food voucher 50 dollars , breakfast provided . professional staff . good layout of room , nice facilities spacious desk , comfortable bed . feel relaxed .

88.review_text: The room was clean and nice, everyone was very friendly and helpful. The hotel also has bar and burger place. The Front Office staff Daryl did a great job - very friendly and polite! What a great experience!

89.review_text: Nice ambience, comfortable bed, liked the thoughtful  amenities which were a little more than the average hotel. Came with masks and nice flower soap. Included a nice breakfast at 25 degrees. Lovely experience.

90.review_text: I booked the single person room here for solo staycation. So the small room is expected but it is still comfortable and cozy.  I love the water bottle which packaged in box instead of plastic.  There’s table right in front of your bed so you could do some work over there.  During this pandemic, it was glad to see them prepared a mask with hand sanitizer.

91.review_text: Fiance and me stayed here for a night. Have no complains about the room, except i just realise all room dont have fridge.... thats the only downside. Apart from that? Everything is ok!!  Nearby to alot of place, mrt so its a good location! Love it alot

92.review_text: Stayed with my partner during weekdays. Being told on arrival on the gym closure and we totally understand this. Didnt make a fuss about it. Room were justifiable to what we have paid. Breakfast too were adequate. Cool hotel makes me feel young again. Great staff very friendly and assist you in any way possible. Noticed that staff is all multitasking as they were seen throughout the hotel. Good service and great attitude. Keep it up!

93.review_text: Local staff so polite go every way to make your stay enjoyable. Nothing to complaint during these periods just feel lucky enough to be served by our local staff. Appreciate them for what they provide and go extra mile by wiping tables, sending food, cleaning our rooms and do check out(same staff)..Kudos team

94.review_text: Front Desk Team were very proficient in doing their duties. Great attitude and follow up with my request were executed perfectly. The Great G package was an added touch of their personalised service the team had to offer. And repeatedly sending my ice bucket request while still smiling (same staff) is a benchmark that all hotels need to follow. Because they do not have room service(in room dining), the staff from the desk made an additional effort to pleased guest by sending our ice and other request during the night. We appreciate your service to ensure we locals have a relaxing stay. Thank you.

95.review_text: Made a booking for  Staycaytion after long staying in Hotels for a very long time. Its refreshing to see the lvel of service provided to me on arrival. I can feel that all the staff at front desk were so excited to welcome me on arrival. They explained that the check in process have changed and extra steps were taken due to the pandemic and to ensure our safety. Room was clean and great looking. Added touch of popcorn given on arrival was an added touch of a great stay. Check out was a breeze as express check out box provided at level 1 & level 2 so there is no Queue!!!

96.review_text: Booked my staycation for 22-22 Nov at the hotel and I eagerly anticipated a relaxing stay. Sadly, I never got that desired experience. Upon check-in,  I found out the hotel gym was closed (only after asking). This was already a deal breaker for me. There had been no indication anywhere (not even on their website or emails to me) that the gym was closed.   With the gym closed, the hotel has ZERO facilities for guests to enjoy. Hotel doesn't offer in-room dining. Staff would rather tell you to make your own orders and come down to pick them up, than even offer the service of bringing the order up to your room.    Room that I was allocated wasn't cleaned properly, and smelt of stale cigarettes, even though they had indicated the floor as a non-smoking floor. Room felt very damp and…

97.review_text: Nice room, Great vibes, will come again! Friendly counter staffs made our check in experience so much easier. Each floor is only accessible to people with the room key for that floor, which gives extra security and privacy to consumers enjoying the hotel G experience.

98.review_text: Great lo  Covid 19 stopped me from my usual weekends overseas vacations. Hence, i can only have my weekends staycation in Singapore. After such i was glad to find Hotel G and,made it my preferred staycation hotel in Singapore after comparasion. The hotel is suituated in a very good location, room is clean and new,staffs are friendly,food of hotel reaturant and cafe is great too and  and best of all value for money.

99.review_text: I booked a staycation at Hotel G for my birthday. We were given a time(15:00-15:55hrs) to check-in due to covid-19 measures. We arrived around 15:20hrs and was shocked to see 8 groups of guests before us. All of us were crowding at Lvl 1 lobby. (Plus point: they provided drinks while we wait) After some time of waiting, we were told that we can go up to Lvl 2 to check-in, however when we arrived at Lvl 2 there was still a queue. So we waited patiently again. When it was our turn to check-in, the front desk informed us that the “Get The Party Started package” décor & props are not in the room yet so they ask if they could send it to our room instead which we said yes because at this point we have already waited for 50mins and we do not want to wait any longer. When the balloons…

100.review_text: Great stay at G Hotel with family, came with breakfast. Returned back for second time! Staff at reception were very pleasant & helpful. Rooms although compact but very modern with great toiletries. We had American Breakfast served wonderfully by Papa & Abigale, very pleasant & sweet staff. :)

1.review_text: Staycation in Singapore  when you cannot travel overseas to celebrate my brother's birthday. Cabin room is nice and it is located at a corner of Jewel, hence quite a lot of walking is required. Jewel has alot to offer, hence the whole staycation was ok

2.review_text: Our room had a faulty air conditioner and we phoned the front desk and a friendly receptionist said that she will get another room ready for us. She even gave us late checkout to 2pm, free vouchers for jewel's shops and restaurants and tickets to the canopy bridge too! We were floored by her service!   Room's bathroom has excellent water pressure and soap smells so good!  We also loved how the tv has chrome cast so we can stream YouTube on it for some karaoke haha!  One downside was that the mattress was a little uncomfortable, it was a tad too soft for my liking.   Other than that, we absolutely loved our stay at yotel air!

3.review_text: Small yet cosy cabin. Staff are friendly at all times. Coffee machine which serves great coffee available 24/7. Location is great. Lots of restaurants around. Enjoyed my stay a lot! Will be back again

4.review_text: Early check-in much appreciated.  Nice clean big family room.  Door was sound proof, lighting was interesting, adjustable bed was a cool touch and toilet amenities were good. Didn’t get a chance to ask for amenities from the robot.

5.review_text: The hotel does not have a window but it has all you need for transit and clean. Very good location and access to the shops and food just below. Wonderful reception staffs and excellent and very caring customer service. Thank you!

6.review_text: This is the perfect layover crash pad in Changi - granted, it's not actually IN Changi, but just a hop skip & a few moving sidewalks away. I've spent plenty of nights at this airport, watching midnight movies, or snoozing in one of the nap rooms. But during my last trip, due to Covid concerns I decided to hunker down in privacy for my 16 hour layover. YOTELAIR did not disappoint. It definitely didn't give hotel vibes upon arrival, but no matter. What I paid for was the bed, and what a bed it was! It was adjustable in every possible permutation I could imagine, which was handy since it was just about the only piece of furniture in the room. The room itself could fit into a bathroom in a Marina Bay Sands suite, which makes it all the more remarkable how much they manage to fit…

7.review_text: Booked my stay the night before at 8pm and was most certainly impressed by the quick replies to my email booking by the reservation staff. After a few email exchanges, I managed to quickly clinched the reservation . I love the way that they responded to my queries, making the email exchanges minimal and as fuss free as possible. I arrived 15min later for my check in the next day and to my pleasant surprise, the check in staff allowed me to check out 15min later. I didn't expect that but it was almost certainly a nice gesture. Thing to take note is that the gym is out of use and no ore free flow coffee and tea now. You would have to ask for the staff to help you but I skipped that part as I find it a hassle to trouble them.

8.review_text: It was awesome experience to stay in the cabin size hotel room. The staffs are friendly and the process of check in and check out are smooth, simple and painless. The room was clean and you don't feel it is a small room.

9.review_text: Staycation within Jewel - great place to be closest to Changi Airport. Convenient shopping, dining and chilling. Friendly staff, easy check in and check out. Great for transiting travellers and for early wee hour check in.

10.review_text: Room is small as expected but the bed is very comfortable, had a fabulous sleep every night! Location is superb as you are spoiled with all the food choices and the awesome rain vortex and canopy park is just a few steps away!

11.review_text: This place is perfect for 3D2N in Jewel Changi Airport. We booked 2 rooms for a family of 5 persons. The room is small but is clean. My childs like it so much especially the Robot delivery amenity things.

12.review_text: It is first time to select a carbin. The surrounding in the carbin is different with ordianry hotel.  I have good experience in Yotel with reasonable price. The faciliates in it is conveninet to use. The room is also clean.

13.review_text: Was looking for somewhere comfortable and cozy to chill and watch Netflix away from home. Noticed that they offer day-rate bookings of 4 and 6 hours. Decided to check it out as it looked good. Booked for 1pm but we checked in at 1:15, the staff gave us extra 15 minutes to check out at 7:30pm. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. TV was great as well as we streamed Netflix

14.review_text: Good location within Jewel. The Rain Vortex is just outside!  Amenities were really basic. No room slippers or face towels were provided though.  Service was efficient but impersonal. The staff hardly smile at all.

15.review_text: Well..theres not much to say. You paid for a room, and you get exactly that. The price was very affordable ($120/n) and the room was small yet cosy. The room was also very clean. The main selling point of this hotel is its location, located right within Jewel. Overall the stay exceeded my expectations.

16.review_text: Just located at level 3 of Jewel Changi..very convenient for solo travellers and transit travellers..nice to shop around too..rooms are pretty small though, so it is not suitable for family travellers.

17.review_text: Booked six rooms for a family staycay. One room for wheelchair accessibility and room was of good size, so is bathroom. Other rooms are tiny,  but super clean and location of hotel was great. Will recommend this hotel (if you don't mind tiny rooms), but it was fine as we spend much time outside too. Smartbed was also a plus,  but take note that shower area in toilet might be slippery.  Other than that,  won't mind staying here again. Thank you! :)

18.review_text: The room is cozy and comfortable, staffs are friendly and helpful.  Due to covid period, some facilities are not open for guest usage, but they are willing to help, like providing hot water when needed and storage of cold items.

19.review_text: This hotel is conveniently located in JEWEL and perfect for travelers who arrive late at night and need a place to stay while awaiting for COVID-19 test results. The beds are very comfortable and staff are very helpful. Highly recommended!

20.review_text: Unlike most hotels, this particular one manages to maintain low cost and high quality cabins. Do take note that their cabins are relatively small than usual and they do not have some amenities like electric kettle where you would expect for most hotels. Nonetheless, great location and experience definitely worth a shot for couples not families

21.review_text: Overall the stay was good. Facilities are pretty vanilla as it was supposed to meant as a stopover stay for travelers. Room was clean and comfy. Check-in and out was fast and easy. Jewel has alot of F&B and supermarket so it is pretty easy. If you like to experience a night at Changi Airport and explore Jewel at night, YOTELAIR is a pretty good choice.

22.review_text: Stay was cosy and easily accessible via the terminals.  Check in was a breeze as the booking was done online and all the staff needed to do was just to scan my NRIC and I am checked-in.  Now with this covid-19 pandemic, the little inconveniences is the scan in for safe-entry & temperature check each time you leave and re-enter the hotel

23.review_text: Great place for short layover with lots of F&B outlets in Jewel, there's also a supermarket at the basement of Jewel. There's also kids facilities spread throughout the mall and a chargeable play area on the top floor.

24.review_text: The kids loved the bunk bed, the lightings in the room and the robots! They were fascinated by the room service by the robots. They wished their staycation was longer and they are missing their bunk bed beds now.

25.review_text: The hotel was excellent, especially the bed, it was so comfortable! The hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful, I would love to visit the hotel again! The bathroom in the cabin was very clean.

26.review_text: Thou the room was small but for a 1 nite stay for our family staycation was just right. The bed were comfy, overall cleanliness is good. Only the toilet flushing system not good.  Staffs are very helpful and friendly. Will come back again

27.review_text: Though the room is small but it is well equipped. It would be better if a kettle can be provided in the room. We called to ask for more water and a robot delivered the bottled water within 10 mins - cool! We woke up early because we could hear footsteps of people running. Overall, I feel that it is a cool hotel and my experience was good.

28.review_text: The hotel is conveniently located within Jewel and there are many things to see, do and eat there. The room was small but comfortable. My friend and I especially like the smart TV which was in the room. If you are claustrophobic, this might not be the hotel for you as it's smaller than usual and the room doesn't have any windows. The amenities provided are good and sufficient. Staff members are vrry friendly and efficient as well.

29.review_text: This hotel is most suited for short layovers, not staycations. Room was small, walls were thin, you could hear what's happening next door or if someone slams the door hard outside. Not much amenities provided and it does get.a little claustrophobic when you stay inside for too long (probably due to no windows).

30.review_text: Checking in is simple, i managed to get a room on the lobby floor so i really like that as there are rooms located on other levels (Lift required), so I have no qualms about it. It's cabin compact which is really comfortable for 1 pax. Bed is very large and cozy. TV is very wide too. Will recommend if you intend to explore Jewel on a short term trip.

31.review_text: Located right inside Jewel, was convenient for us to shop and catch a late night movie.   The room was small and no window. However, it was ok since we didn't have any luggage and outside most of the time. Room was clean. Queen bed could recline and comfy!   The experience was good and we will want to return in future.

32.review_text: TV is quite useless unless we are allowed to connect to the TV by HDMI, which is technically possible but not recommended by the staff. The staff was quite helpful in getting that set up for us; the room we were originally in did not allow that but we made a room switch and were able to.  Chromecast is not enough for connecting devices to the TV because there are many devices that are not chromecast compatible, like nintendo switch.

33.review_text: The hotel is good for transit but probably not for a staycation even though the location is ideal. The cabin rooms could have been larger or at least equipped with some fixtures to enable a more pleasant stay. Nevertheless, it is still a good experience for a one night stay.

34.review_text: It is a simple hotel with amenities all included in. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. Perfect for those looking to have a lazy day with your partner and just chill during this lockdown period

35.review_text: Slept in for one night. Small & Cosy room, solid soundproof, good water pressure. Everything you need are in the room within reach but except for mini fridge to chill your beverages.  Overall good stay! 👍🏻

36.review_text: Had a staycation here for my wife's birthday. Check in experience however was less than ideal. Even though we were all masked up, the guy who serviced us did not offer any smile and seemed to only go thru the motion. Whats worse is, he did not inform us of the free WiFi that is available. Apart from service, Yotelair may wish to state up front on their website that the hotel is also providing quarantine space for covid-19 suspects so that customers can make an informed decision.

37.review_text: The staff service attitude were all awesome and extremely friendly to us. Most importantly, they make my family feels like home during our stay even with the implement measures for COVID. Great experience!

38.review_text: Located at 4th floor of Jewel Changi Airport, if traveler is in transit and out from airside, this hotel is ideal for catching quick rest or have good sleep.  Although room is small and no window, it is well designed and never felt too small or feel confined. There is good space for putting big luggage under the bed.  Room is equipped with minimal amenities such as body wash, shampoo, dental kit, bath towel, hair dryer and bottled water.  No bathrobe, slippers and coffee and tea making facility.   Staffs are attentive, helpful and welcoming.

39.review_text: Booked a room from Agoda on the 23 July for a day staycation at Jewel Yotelair Hotel occupied in Room 202. To me staycation mean can enjoy myself in hotel even in own country Singapore.  Unfortunately, upon checking in at 12:30 hrs I was rejected. The hotel only allowed to check in at 1800 hrs and MUST check out the following morning by 0900 hrs. Agoda did not clearly stated on the hotel check in/out policy timing on the voucher. The receptionist lady kind enough allowed me to check in 2 hrs earlier at 1600 hrs.  It seems more to me staying for transit instead of staycation 🤦‍♂️

40.review_text: Stayed for four nights as soon as the hotel reopened for staycations because of home renovations and a wisdom tooth surgery. Check-in was smooth and fuss-free, found my way to my room which was tucked in a quiet corner after getting a little lost (way finding design could have been better) at first ... understand that the hotel has had several bookings during my stay but never did run into anyone apart from the hotel staff during this time. Staff were very polite and helpful, especially since I couldn't speak halfway through my stay.   Room is definitely very clean, very quiet but also very tight for two persons. Honestly, their premium queen is perfect for solo travellers. The shower area could have been better designed given that it makes the floor wet as others have also…

41.review_text: Our flight arrived in Singapore late in the evening, and we were to board a cruise ship the next day. YotelAir was a great solution for our needs. Located in The Jewel at Changi Airport, it was as simple as walking from the airport terminal to the hotel.  Exhausted from a long day of international travel, check in was very easy. You can check in at one of the kiosks in the lobby or with an attendant. We went straight up to the room for a good night's sleep.  Yes, the room is very small, even for 2 people, but it's only meant to be a place to sleep. For us, it provided what we needed - a convenient and clean place to sleep for a reasonable price.  Its location allowed us to explore The Jewel in the morning before taking the Metro to the cruise ship terminal. With plenty of…

42.review_text: We stayed here as arriving from London we wouldn’t have been able to connect to our final destination and due to landing at 5.30pm we didn’t want to travel into Singapore again. (We have been before) our flight was early next morning too. We found this hotel was located in Jewel in Terminal 1 where our flight from London and departed to Malaysia the next day so it was perfect.  The rooms are slightly on the small side there’s no “social room” but that was fine as we went into Jewel and had dinner and then went to bed and were checked out early.  The facilities around it will definitely keep you entertained for a layover visit but I wouldn’t stay longer than one night as it seems impossible to get out for fresh air!!  Rooms whilst small were very cosy and the beds very comfy.…

43.review_text: Been stayed in this transit hotel while my transit to yangon September 2019, the room is very clean and pleasant. Since the room so small, it’s only recommended for someone in transit and not bring a lot of luggages. But not like other transit capsule hotel that only have share bathrooms and toilets, the room equipped with a shower and toilet.   The room rate is a bit pricey but located at the heart of changi’s newest mall Jewel. Just a view step from your hotel lobby will will see the famous waterfall of jewel. Many shops and restaurants around the mall.   Definitely will come again to this hotel while transit in singapore.

44.review_text: I stayed here for a 12 hrs overnight connection between flights.  Check in was quick and friendly. I enjoyed the lounge vibe and modern decor.  My room was compact but functional. It was very clean and everything was in working order. The bed was comfortable, TV and internet service was very good.  It was much quieter than I expected.   It is expensive considering the room size and lack of amenities compared to a regular hotel but I needed the sleep and wanted to experience the hotel.

45.review_text: We stayed in the YotelAir Changi for two nights in March. We arrived from Australia late on Sunday evening, and flew out again early on Tuesday morning. The walk from Terminal 1 to and from the hotel was unbeatable - so easy and quick.  At check in we were temperature checked with little fuss, and quickly sent upstairs to our room.   My mother and I each had our own room, and they were perfect for 1 person - 2 people would also be ok as long as you were prepared to be very close. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean. There were water bottles, hand and body wash, toothbrushes, hairdryer - everything you need for a quick stay.  The Changi Jewel complex is amazing, so many food and shopping options right outside the hotel door. The garden is very relaxing and definitely…

46.review_text: I stayed at YOTELAIR at Jewel Changi Airport for one night after the weather rained on my camping plans as I was on my way to the campsite.  Firstly, I love Changi Airport and YOTELAIR gave me the perfect way to stay in the airport and shop and eat without worrying about a long journey home.  The room is positively tiny, but to be expected for transit travellers. It is clean, the Smart bed (electric inclination settings) is very comfy and the room will easily accommodate two adults. Add a young child and that is about it. A fourth would have to sleep on the floor.  The rainfall shower is a nice touch, as is the complimentary basic amenitiee of shower gel, toothbrush and toothpaste.  There is no hot water kettle in the room although they provide two bottles of water. However, I…

47.review_text: Looked nice room and very compact but just enough space if it is only one traveler. Then I discovered the number of fleas in the room. Glad to get out.  You pay a VERY high price and get substandard sanitation.

48.review_text: A terrific place to stay overnight for a great sleep and to refresh for the next leg of your journey. Highly recommend this place. It was easy to find and check-in, cosy in a futuristic, space age sort of way and very clean. Slept soundly in the super comfortable bed.

49.review_text: Had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel when in Singapore. It is ideally located in the airport itself. The rooms were clean, cozy and well equipped. Every member of staff who we dealt with was  excellent and very friendly - in particular in sorting out a refund for us after we had inadvertently doubled booked a room. Many thanks.

50.review_text: very small room - and just because it is at the airport is has the possibility to be so expensive. Else it would be worth maybe 50SGD per night... room rate not even include breakfast! Rooms are NOT soundproofed towards other guests - and sometimes these are making a lot of noise. Room is not very dark because there are LEDs everywhere - the TV, the smoke detector, the plug

51.review_text: Since I had a late arrival from abroad and early start next day. We decided to try out YotelAir concept. For future travels. Found the staff to be friendly and informative. The room was good clean and served the purpose for a good night sleep. After awhile the bed was a little bit saggy. The luggage capacity can be limited if you have allot. We had only normal and that went just fine. Can recommend it as a nice place to spend your time for a stop-over stay. Will for sure try out the concept other places.

52.review_text: Conveniently located just inside Jewel/Changi Terminal 1. Checking in experience was fast, friendly and accommodating counter staff. The room is small, very clean toilet with modern amenities. This is really good as a transient accommodation for travelers. Step outside the hotel you will find everything from coffee shops, restaurants and shopping! It is basically an accommodation inside the mall, the famous touristed Jewel at Changi airport!

53.review_text: Cabins though small, were great and provided everything, free Wifi, coffee and tea, bottled water, tooth brush and toothpaste. Very comfy bed which could be adjusted positioned in front of TV. Coffee and Tea is free 247 so after we checked out whilst waiting for our flight we helped ourselves to the coffee machine and sat on the deck area watching the Indoor waterfall.

54.review_text: The room was clean, the shower was large, the bed queen size and comfortably firm without being rock hard or pillow soft and the sheets crisp. There was shower gel & shampoo with toothbrush & paste. Hairdryer available.

55.review_text: Stayed here because a delayed flight resulted in a long transit time. After an incredibly anxious and stressful day, YOTELAIR was wonderful. It was comfortable and clean and exactly what I needed. Would recommend, and would stay there again.

56.review_text: Enjoyed my stay here. Located at T1 so very close to arrival and departure plus food court is close to the hotel. Pretty expensive, but convenient. Would stay again. Great shower and very clean. Thanks

57.review_text: Nice comfortable, convenient, clean place, highly recommend if you need to fransis in Singapore. Pretty conviniently locaties, small copy clean room. I wish the toilet are not glass partition, if u r with family with kids thats bit inconvinient.

58.review_text: Extremely convenient. Amazing stunning location overlooking the jewel waterfall. Great for an overnight stay during transit. Access to the cinema, food courts, shopping, trams, airport.. pretty much everything you need!

59.review_text: A bit of a walk from the gate but follow the directions given and not too difficult to find. The rooms are really clean, well thought out and have everything you need - I just needed somewhere to get some sleep and freshen up after arriving at 04:30 without the usual time constraints of a traditional hotel.

60.review_text: This was a great place to shower and rest during my layover in Singapore, however I really struggled with the confined space of this room.  All amenities and toiletries were provided, and staff were great (even for a check-in at 1am), however it was simply the room size which may prevent me from booking again.

61.review_text: Yotelair is easy to find and access from the airport is via the link bridge or by train, It is very clean, modern and comfortable and is in shopping mall with all its restaurants and the amazing indoor waterfall.

62.review_text: Modern, comfortable, everything in place, good quiet, dark (nice to have no windows when you sleep in the day), plenty of room. Hourly price is a bit expensive. Very good service check-in desk. Free gym and a beautiful view of the Jewel's Waterfall from where you drink coffee.

63.review_text: Perfect for quick stop as the cabin is rather small, however fully functional. Comfortable, convertible bed with big TV screen gives nice ‘cinema’ effect. Clean, nice smell, cosy lights. Recommendable!😎🖖

64.review_text: How could you beat this!  Clean and beautiful mall with a hotel onsite. Gorgeous canopy park and waterfall music program, lots of food variety and unique stores...fantastic!  I could stay here for days, not just transit.

65.review_text: I have stayed in yotel few times now. It is very good and comfortable every time we stay there. Its kids and family friendly place. Location is perfect and very convenient it’s located right in the heart of jewel.

66.review_text: This was exactly what we needed for our longer transfer from New Zealand, close to the airport, convenient for early baggage check in which is just a couple of floors below and in a good spot for getting food and getting into the city via the MRT. The room was spotless and check in staff were very friendly and helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable!

67.review_text: Very functional and affordable place to stay and refresh. Ideal for an extended transit period. Highly recommended. Cabins are not spacious but just right for the purpose. Located in Jewel annex to airport (landside). Leaving the airport and returning there quite easy. Very good experience overall.

68.review_text: We spent one night here. The location is great, especially if you're arriving at Changi Airport T1. After you finish immigration, you're starting at the entrance to Jewel. An elevator to the 4th floor Yotelair location is just a few steps away.  Check-in was easy, and the rooms were perfect for a short stay. Very compact, but well-designed with spaces for luggage. We didn't have windows in our two rooms (maybe others have them?), but the lighting is such that it really didn't matter for a single night stay. The bed, bedding, and pillows were excellent, and the shower was strong and easy to figure out (no small thing when jetlagged!). There's a gym, but we didn't use it. Good, new, and plentiful equipment, from what I could tell. But of course the best feature is that you are in…

69.review_text: Pros:  Our second time here because it was just so convenient for a last night's stay before our flight - no need to rush to the airport (since we're just 10 minutes walk away from our departure terminal), and having the time to explore the amazing Changi Jewel late into the night and have our accommodation right upstairs.  Kiddos loved the fact of staying at a mega posh mall with lots to see and do, waking up to the view of a gigantic indoor water fall at breakfast, and the fun bunk beds in the family room. Excited to see the robots at work too.  Cons: Booking system not standardized. Called in few days before checking in to find out why we were charged more than online rates but were told by reservation staff that HER back end system showed we got the best rates. Strange.  …

70.review_text: A beutiful place.Easy to find. Easy to go in. Very clean.soft bed. Good price. Coffee free. Lots of shops and restaurants. A good spot to enjoy before a flight or after a flight. Lot of restaurants. Beutiful!

71.review_text: Great for transit stopovers, very understanding and helpful staff.  Located within the Jewel so gives you access to a large number of outlets and eateries.  I had a 16 hour transit, and was able to recharge myself very well!

72.review_text: The best location for a transit passengers, I a walking distance from terminal 1. After 8 hours good sleep, Changi Jewels is a good place to spend 2-3 hours - this is how you can organise your 12 hours transit here.

73.review_text: A good place for a transit stay in the heart of the amazing Jewel Shopping complex.  Rooms were clean and compact with great amenities and inclusions,  The rooms are great for what they are designed for, short term stays, with enough room to unwind, but not enough to spread too far out and may not suit more than 2 people

74.review_text: This is our second stay at a YOTELAIR, the first being London Heathrow so we knew what to expect of the room. A very compact room with a comfy bed for a good night sleep and great shower to start the day fresh. What I didn't know is the amazing view from the breakfast room (complimentary coffee and tea, breakfast buffet S$10) of the centerpiece of the Jewel, the water spout feature and surrounding rain forest flora. It put me in such a peaceful state I almost forgot about the 20 hour flight to reach Singapore. I chose to stay here because our flight arrived at 1:30 AM but frankly, I'd stay here again no matter what time I arrived or departed.

75.review_text: Easy access to airport, rooms small but functional, clean and modern, excellent for over night transit and shopping centre was impressive. Staff were helpful and friendly, did not use any of the other facilities.

76.review_text: We stayed here for 11 hours on our way through Singapore and couldn't recommend it enough!! Super cool and clean cabins with led lighting and good size shower etc, smart TV so you can cast all your favorite apps, comfy bed and nice and quiet! Right in the heart of the Jewel, fantastic!!!

77.review_text: We have an almost 24 hours transit on our way from Jakarta to Hanoi via Singapore, since we haven’t visited Jewel Changi, so we thought we should explore it since it’s so big and new.
