When we try to find a close by hotel to sleep in during our transit, we saw this Yotelair and when we saw the room size and picture, it’s too interesting and we decided to book it.  When we enter the cabin (that’s how they called their room), we already expect it to be a small size room, so we already prepared to not bring a big luggage, just one carry-on for the 2 of us, and it fits right under the bed. Our bed is a queen size which can be a sofa as well. The one thing that I don’t like is, the TV is so big and so close from the bed which kinda hurt my eyes, but my husband loves it 😅  We do…

78.review_text: Loved it, so small, yet the best comfort especially as we had been on a 20hr flight. It was just what the doctor ordered. Super clean and the most plush bed of all time. It was amazing and the bott was an added bonus.

79.review_text: Convenient and comfortable, space is  small, no place to open luggages, hard for second person to get on the bed.  The lights are too neon bright, check in is later than traditional hotels, hard to book, need to have a disclaimer that it is not the same as Yotel in the city

80.review_text: Clean comfortable rooms. Small but that's to be expected. The walls are thin! The endless drone of the neighbouring room's tv affected my peace and quiet. Fortunately I had a noise cancelling headset otherwise I would have asked for another room.

81.review_text: Booked a family room at this hotel  since we had a late arrival (11pm).  It may take some weaving around the airport up to the hotel ( just make sure you get into the right elevator as they have one near them) . I booked through their website and I requested  them for a room near the reception area since I was with my elderly parents and they really gave me a room that was accessible.  The family cabin was nice with all the amenities we needed. Some might think its a bit small but again they have unique ways of placing the practical things you need for your stay.  We previously stayed in yotel hotel  in Orchard road (2018)   and the rooms are actually similar.  I love that you can adjust the bed  , very helpful for my parents  who had a very restful sleep.  We were able to go…

82.review_text: I made a reservation to stay for one night through a third party site. I received a confirmation email from Yotel and only then did they inform me that CHECK IN TIME IS AFTER 6PM AND CHECKOUT TIME IS BEFORE 9AM!   That is a half day’s stay and yet they charge a full day’s fee! It would have been acceptable if they showed these in bold letters during the reservation process. None of the sort.  Unfortunately this did not coincide with my plans.  I needed to be able to rest from a long flight and be able to checkin by 2pm as most hotels allow.  I emailed to request but the hotel reverted with a closed-for-the-day reply.  I cancelled and informed third party reservation site to request for a waiver of penalties.  Of course Yotel changi refused. So, remember, half day stay only! And…

83.review_text: We stayed at YotelAir Changi for one night late December. For our requirements YotelAir was perfect. The Premium Queen Cabin was larger than expected with enough room to manoeuvre around our two suitcases providing we placed them upright against the wall after we had taken what we needed from them. The bed was very comfy indeed and the idea of the electric tilt and lower was fabulous. Raise up and you have a place to sit comfortably whilst watching the TV and lower, you have a bed! The bathroom was a good size, not much different to some normal hotel rooms and it all worked very well indeed. I had been a little cautious of not having a window, but it didn’t bother me in the slightest once I saw what the room was like. The location inside Jewel was unbeatable, just a one minute…

84.review_text: Had an early morning flight coupled with cat's curiosity, decided to spend a night at this cabin spaced  hotel.  Had a good night's rest.  Had a chance to walk all 6 storeys of the mega mall.  The food oferings in the basement levels were good.  Each floor had a different targeted audience which makes shopping easy.    Saw a good number of people making use of the early check in counters on the first.  Having a good view of the Vortex attraction from their lounge was also another a plus.  With friendly staff and clean rooms.  Not a bad overnight stay.

85.review_text: You need to stay minimum 4 hours and we paid slightly over SGD $100.  Room is very tiny.  It supposed to come with WiFi.  It has shower and toilet in the room.  Apart from being tiny, we do find the room a bit suffocating as the air cond is too low to our liking.

86.review_text: Very well, located, crispy clean, uniquely organized, comfortable bed and a realistic starting or ending accommodation for many travellers. The room was an education on interlocking designs and useful use of usable space.  I really liked this room. The hotel theme was also rather catchy.

87.review_text: Great location right in the heart of the Jewel at Changi Airport. The location just can’t be beat, so convenient and about a 30 second walk from my room to the view of the Rain Vortex.  I stayed one night before my flight out of Singapore. Check in and check out was super easy and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  I have previously stayed in a Yotel and my only real gripes were that I found the bed somewhat uncomfortable and the sound of people coming and going outside my room at night was quite noisy and kept waking me up.  All in all great value for money in a great location.

88.review_text: This is not your regular hotel, and it is not meant to be one. It is designed for people in transit and only has enough space for a hand-carry. Note that check-in is 6PM, however we arrived at 4.30PM and were allowed to go straight in. Not sure if booking direct made a difference to this. Pros: superb bedding for two, nice shower, short walking distance to the terminal. Cons: premium pricing for a small room. Coffee and tea is available in the reception area, wifi is strong, wake-up call at 4AM is done by a real person and you get to enjoy Jewel during your transit without your carry-on. If you need a bigger room, there's a Crowne Plaza in T3, or other hotels around the city. Would I stay here again? Yes, if I've less than 20-hour in Singapore and I get to sleep in for another…

89.review_text: Extremely close to airport but you have to clear immigration to get to it - make sure you don't need a visa to enter Singapore - trendy,clean hotel - if you just want a transit hotel - use one within the airport

90.review_text: Yes, this hotel does have very small cabins, as they call them. But if you want a really comfy bed for an overnight at the beginning or end of your stay in Singapore, this is hard to beat. The mechanism on the bed allows you to choose fully flat or tilted up - it's that easy. The en-suite shower room even has toothbrushes and toothpaste and plenty of good quality towels. We parked our cases in the Baggage Storage facility in Jewel for a few hours and then used the nearby early check-in. Then we were free of baggage to look around and have dinner.  An early morning wake-up call from Reception next day, a good continental breakfast here and off we went - all of a five minute walk to Terminal 1. No more taxi rides across town in the traffic. Will definitely stay here again - also…

91.review_text: For our trip to Borneo we stayed here after arriving in Singapore late at night and again at the end of our trip when we had an early morning departure. It really reduced the stress to be able to just take a short walk to or from the airport facilities (literally a 5-minute walk when we departed) without the cost or hassle of navigating to/from downtown. It's a super modern facility with a robot who can check you in or deliver towels, etc.(there's humans too!). The famous rain vortex is just steps away from the check-in desk. The rooms are called cabins because they are super small like a cruise ship cabin but well designed to make use of the space and really comfortable beds. It's a good 10-15 minute walk to the subway station but all inside with some moving walkways.

92.review_text: Not bad. Location is definitely a winning as there are plenty of attractions nearby Our feedbacks are: accessible room rather far, uncomfortable purple ambient light, lack of space (like small desk/table/cabinet/etc) to put belongings)

93.review_text: For those who are traveling to Changi Airport late flight or need to board the plane early flight, this is the best place to stay and to enjoy shopping and Jewel!  We stayed in the family room of four which had great time.  The cost is a bit expensive but if you book as early as you could, it lest than USD 200  for the family room.

94.review_text: We enjoyed one night in Singapore between two long flights - perfect location and a very comfortable bed. Do plan to store your large baggage pieces at the nearby baggage storage facility (extra cost).

95.review_text: I just needed a one night stay post-flight/pre-flight.  The solo cabin was perfect size for one person.   Unfortunately, my neighbors were loud and banging a lot but if it weren't for them (no fault of Yotel) my sleep would have been perfectly restful.  I requested a wake-up call and it was an actual HUMAN that called me!  That was amazing!  Breakfast was continental and it was enough for me before I left for my flight back home.

96.review_text: I have made a last minute booking thru agoda for my guest arriving on day itself. Confirmation ID and letter was sent to my guest to show to the Hotel staff upon check in. However, when he arrived at the front desk, he waited for quite a while, it was 12am and staff claimed that he could not find our booking. Hence he was left with no choice but to make a booking again on the spot.  This is really unacceptable, I called back the hotel and now another lady claims that they found the booking and there's duplicate.  Called Agoda for a refund but claimed that 3rd party does not honor this.  If it is our mistake, we will gladly accept this but this is a mistake of a check in staff. Hence I felt this is unacceptable.  Hotel staff name: Afix

97.review_text: We were flying in at 1am and wanted somewhere to sleep before heading into Singapore and our other hotel.   We're glad we did because the flight was delayed and we didn't get in until 4am.  Quick walk and we were in the hotel.  They say it's a 9am checkout, but they gave us 2 extra hours because we got in so late.  The room is very clean but tiny.  Basically it’s a queen bed with a small walk space beside it and a bathroom behind.  It was perfect for what we wanted.  Just a place to sleep.

98.review_text: Very tired it's now 4am, we landed in Singapore at 230am. Booked the Yotel air hotel, Singapore airport for the 14/15 Jan. The reception had us down for the 15/16 Jan. We booked thru Agoda reservation#445632169.  The manager told us it was a glitch in Agoda's system. However since we are stranded with two young kids at 4am in the lobby we had the privilege of watching the manager sell another story to another family. They too have been told their reservation is unavailable due to a glitch! So it would seem it's not Agoda but Yotel with an internal problem.  The manager was hoping we would walk and try and sort it out with Agoda.  Please note it's not an easy task to get a hold of Agoda when the booking goes wrong.  We have fully paid for this room well in advance.  I asked the…

99.review_text: We stayed in a family room and it was small (as expected) but had everything we needed for a one night stay.   The biggest issue for us was the inability to sleep due to the noise from the adjoining room and the hallway. We could hear every time someone walked past - which is a lot in an airport-based hotel!   Also, I see another reviewer mentioned that the bedding for adults was more substantial than for the kids. This makes it very difficult to set a temperature for everyone to enjoy. Looks like the child bedding was best, as the room never actually got very cool even when set at 21 degrees.   While the beds were comfy, the room clean and the location good, I can't rate this hotel any higher as we left exhausted from a poor night's sleep.

100.review_text: Stayed in many great hotels, this is just not worth the money, its a bed and bathroom , very small. I had no idea when I booked this that it would be just a cabin, I would have stayed across the road in a proper hotel, Breakfast was at 6.30 and we had to leave, they still deemed it necessary to charge me $40.00 plus for nothing.   DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!
